Título: SpongeBob SquarePants: Battle for Bikini Bottom Rehydrated
Comentario:
SpongeBob SquarePants: BfBB R. was released June 23rd of this year, that is 2020, and, for people who didn’t know, is actually a remake of the original 2003 game, hence the “Rehydrated” in the title. This remake was developed by Purple Lamp Studios, and published by THQ Nordic, who you might know from Darksiders, great game. 

The game was released for PC, Xbox One and PS4, but I’ve only played it on PC so I can’t tell you what performance is like on other platforms. Also worth noting this isn’t a comparison review, it’s a review of the remake, and yes there will be a few comparisons, maybe. 
Let’s move on to Story & Gameplay. 

STORY AND GAMEPLAY

So this being a SpongeBob game, you should expect a SpongeBob story, meaning a silly, ridiculous and nonsensical story. And that’s exactly what it is: Plankton wants to take over using robots, but fails terribly when he forgets to set the robots to “Obey” mode, and it’s up to SpongeBob, Patrick and Sandy, to save Bikini Bottom.

Like I said, it’s a spongebob game, and story wise, it’s got everything you could possibly expect from a spongebob story. It’s just pure silliness, that’s all. It’s not gonna be for everyone, obviously if you don’t like SpongeBob, well I’d say you’ll quickly get annoyed by the childishness of the game. And I’ll be honest, sometimes SpongeBob’s laugh or the humour of the game got on my nerves a bit, but I felt like it was a bit unfair to complain since that’s literally what SpongeBob is, silly childish humour. 

Other than that there really isn’t much else to say about the story. The game is divided into the three sections of Bikini Bottom, and each section contains several areas for you to explore. In each of these areas you can switch between certain characters to solve certain puzzles, and your goal is essentially to find as many Golden Spatulas so you can open other areas. You usually will be getting these by completing little objectives or collecting objects, but you can also trade currency and collectibles for them too. By the way, there’s a total of 10 areas, and most of them have other characters in them which’ll give you mini objectives to complete for a spatula.

So there’s actually quite a fair amount to do, really. Naturally, it’s not an open world game filled with side quests and whatnot, but it’s got a good amount of content. There’s also a few bosses you get to fight. In terms of how the game actually plays, well, like I said you get to control three characters, Spongebob, sandy and patrick, and they’ve each got different attack sets, and Spongebob can learn different moves throughout the game. That’s pretty much it.

Gameplay wise the game really isn’t complicated, it’s a mix of simple combat and platforming, and it works very well for this particular game. You’ve gotta remember, it was probably aimed at younger audiences, so it’s just important to take the game for what it is.

The game also ran very smoothly, I never had any crashes or fps drops or anything like that.

I do have one or two complaints though, which I think are reasonable, since these concern the technical aspect of the game. I did encounter some bugs such as getting stuck here and there, and my only other complaint, is that the game tends to reset progress for some objectives sometimes. I’m not talking about enemies here, that respawn when you exit an area, but sometimes the game would reset some progress I’d made because I died, and it could be a bit frustrating at times, admittedly. 

Other than that, really nothing bad to say. Typical spongebob story accompanied by simple, fluid gameplay. Pretty chill and easy going on the whole. 

VISUALS

When it comes to visuals & graphics, I must say this game looks pretty good. It’s to be expected, of course, we are in 2020 after all, but the game looks very visually pleasing, and the colour palette is one my eyes certainly enjoyed. The colours didn’t feel over saturated, they didn’t pop out too too much, it was just a very nice look for game. 

It’s also a pretty good improvement from the original game, which is also to be expected. The character models are a lot more detailed, I’ll try and put up some pictures so you guys can see, but each character’s models is really nicely done, and looks a lot more like the show than they did in the original. Animations are very clean too, and the characters you play also have idle animations which I thought was pretty cool. 

So very nice visuals on the whole, didn’t have issues such as texture popping or blurry textures, everything looked really nice, and the colours were really pleasing. 

SOUND & MUSIC

Alright, music! Well, like a lot of other aspects of this game, the game’s music is really what you would expect from it. Obligatory, the Spongebob theme song is in the game, but other than that you have your typical Spongebob music, with the hawaiian ish guitar usually leading. This is usually the case for the game’s hub, Bikini Bottom, but each area has got its little soundtrack too. 

As for sound, it’s very cartoon ish, as you might expect. For example, a spring noise for jumping, the boing noise, the slap noise for attacking, things like that. 

Regarding sound and music, I don’t have much else to say. The game’s sound design is on the whole pretty good, nothing spectacular of course, but definitely nice to listen to. 

FINAL THOUGHTS & OPINION

Well, this was a relatively short review I’d say, and I know I’ve said this a few times already, but this game is exactly what you would expect from a Spongebob game. I saw a lot of people hating on the game for being dumb and whatever, but like, that’s exactly what Spongebob is. 

So just keep this in mind when buying the game, it is mostly aimed at people who like Spongebob, and well, naturally, it’s gonna have Spongebob things, such as silly humour, dum dum characters and a ridiculously absurd story. 

However, I don’t wanna gatekeep this game, and I do think that if you’re into platforming games and just want a relaxing, chill time, then this game might be for you. It can actually get somewhat challenging at times, if you’ve watched my let’s play you’ll know I actually died a few times, and I can’t tell if that’s embarrassing or not. 

Again, keep in mind this is a spongebob game, and it’s exactly what you would expect from a spongebob game, pure silliness and simple fun. If you can’t accept that, you’ll get annoyed very easily. 
Overall, very fun and chill game, and a great improvement over the original game, mostly on the visual side of things. 

That’s gonna be it for my review, I hope it wasn’t too short, but really there’s only so much I can talk about concerning this game, and I feel like I’ve said what I needed to. Again, remember it’s a spongebob game, not some full blown action rpg with amazing mechanics.

Comentario:
This is basically the game you were waiting for. It is a must buy for every DBZ fan (and not only) who can afford it. 

Storyline 10/10

I really like the idea of the storyline. Basically, you make your own character (you can choose between Saiyan, Human, Majin, Namekian and Freeza's race) and you travel in time with Trunks because some of the events are changing (for example Vegeta kills everyone when he first arrives on Earth) so you have to help. Those changes are caused by 2 persons which appear only in the game. You can also do parralel quests either alone or with other players and you can even speak with them. This game is playable both online and offline ( you can play it with a friend if you have 2 controllers).

Graphics 8/10

It kind of resemble the original series so it's not the best one. I like the fact that you have better combat system and far more abilities.

Themes / music 8/10

I don't really like the in-game themes but the intro is really awesome (at least for me).

Overall 9/10

A good thing is that you can select the voice language (English or Japanese). Some characters can be unlocked only when you meet certain requirements. Most of the abilities (if not all) can be bought from the in-game store a certain amount of in-game currency (Zeni, so you don't need real money), for example Super Saiyan (ultimate ability) can be bought when you reach a certain level (16 I think) for 50000 Zeni. It can only be purchased by the ones who made a character from the Saiyan race. It also respects the original one so it drains your Ki pretty quickly. Overall, the game is really nice and you have a lot of things to do in it.

P.S. I haven't even experienced online battles yet :D

We Happy Few is an open world survival, adventure game with a dystopian setting. This game was crowd funded and was very hyped leading up to its launch. So did it live up to it?

So, have you taken your Joy today?
The premise of the game is that Britain gave all of its children to Germany at the end of The World War.
You play as 3 different characters with different playstyles and story arcs. In this world everyone have to take an anti-depressant called Joy. 
The game has a beautifully designed dystopian open world that is very Orwellian. There are NPC’s called “Bobbies”(constables) that are there as enforcers. If they think someone isn’t taking their Joy then they go and correct that. Even in a small group they can be difficult to deal with. Even in everyone’s house’s there is this contraption known as a “Down Detector” that can detect if you are not taking your Joy and call the Bobbies on you.

Hey! You there, why are you running?!
In most games the NPCs will turn a blind eye to the fact that you are carrying a weapon and behaving oddly, but not in We Happy Few. Here, if you are running without reason in the city then the Bobbies will be after you. If you are walking around with a weapon then you better make sure no one spots you, unless you want to face the Bobbies again. 

Open up! I want my Blackberry Joy!

You play as 3 characters, Arthur, Sally and Ollie. Once you finish one character’s arc and are about to move onto the next you will be notified, as you will not be able to go back and play as the previous character. 
Each one of them has a different story and playstyle. 
For example, Sally(my favorite of the 3), is a chemist who has to stick to a schedule because the constables want her “Blackberry Joy” on a regular basis at a specific time, so you better make sure that you are ready with it on the dot. 
This is something you have to do in between everything else. 
The game also has a skill system and the skills offered are very apt to your situation, for example one of the perks lets you run without arousing suspicion. This is extremely useful as playing without this throughout the entire game may feel tedious as the mechanism of acting a character may get boring towards the end of the game, but this will let you be a bit more free. 
The game looks beautiful as well throughout the most parts with only some instances of texture issues.

What will the Down Detector say about this game?
What about the negatives? Well, right now there are few negatives. There are few bugs, but nothing major that would ruin your experience with the game.

Will I need to take some Joy to playthrough the game?
To sum it up, this game is one with lots of potential and ambition but sadly bugs ruin the perfect picture. If you love the idea of the game then you probably won’t regret getting.

Reviewer: Sylla UG

Comentario:
Niche - a genetics survival game est un jeu unique où la survie, comme un jeu de cette catégorie, nécessitera de trouver des ressources pour nourrir vos espèces mais également, devra passer par la case génétique pour choisir des gènes précis, utiles pour rester en vie. Il n'y a pas de gênes "meilleurs" que d'autres, il faudra choisir en fonction de votre environnement et de manière réfléchis. Chaque détail comptera et la consanguinité sera très punitive. Il faudra alors user de ruse, et de chance (surtout de chance), pour passer d'îles en îles et de jour en jour, en conservant vos créatures. 
Ce n'est pas le jeu mignon gnan-gnan où vous élèverez des créatures plus choux les unes que les autres ; on parle là, bien de survie par l'espèce, de difficulté et de décisions parfois punitives.

On peut malheureusement se plaindre d'une sorte de redondance après 20h heures de jeu, et des décès causés trop rapidement. Aussi, la dureté de conserver de bons gènes sans consanguinités, force parfois à l'extinction, surtout sans une dose de chance, ce qui peut augmenter la sensation de frustration. Des onglets ou possibilités inutiles ou non-expliqués et des graphismes plutôt moyens. 

En conclusion : Niche - a genetics survival game n'est pas à mettre entre toutes les mains, Vous devrez faire procréer vos créatures dans le soucis de la survie par l'espèce dans son environnement. C'est un jeu punitif et compliqué, qui, passé les graphismes un peu laid, vous fera hurler de douleurs lorsque votre espèce s'éteindra, et/ou vous fera ressentir un sentiment de puissance lorsque celle-ci prospérera.

Título: Sword Art Online Re: Hollow Fragment
EARTH DEFENSE FORCE 4.1 The Shadow of New Despair
Comentario:
Jeu W.T.F complétement nanard mais qui s'assume complétement , je le trouve assez addictif et jouissif .

graphisme complétement dépassé , et déjà à l'époque , l'avantage reste que ça tourne sur tout et ce permets d'afficher énormément d’ennemis à l’écran.

Un jeu un Sérious Sam dans le monde Starship Troopers et de mecha géant . 

Smple , Fun , Agréable , j'ai découvert la série il y a peu , je me suis procuré donc celui-ci pour un prix réduit afin de me faire une 1ère impression sur la licence .

Pas un gros jeu , mais terriblement fun , 5 niveaux de difficultés , 4 classes bien distinctes , beaucoup d'armes à looter, beaucoup d'ennemis , beaucoup de mission. Solo ou multi ( l'expérience est meilleure en multi , encore pas mal de lobby actifs a trouver plutôt facilement )

Je pense que le 5 pallie quelques soucis de gameplay de celui-ci , néanmoins le 5 est encore a prix trop haut à mon sens , vous souhaitez rentrer dans la série E.D.F pour un bon délire ,

Comentario:
I think it's a very nice boardgame, that can get a little too much from RNG sometimes, but gets very fun to play. 
Another thing i really like about this game is the soundtrack, with nice music and funny sounds. And the art for me is another big plus, i feel it very special and well blended in general. For me a very nice boardgame to play with friends some evenings. Highly recommended.

Título: Star Wars Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast
Comentario: 90 car aucun jeu n'est parfait. Même il faut avouer que tout comme le 1er JK, Outcast a révolutionner la gameplay au sabre laser. Posant de belles bases pour jedi academy. Les boss comme les ennemis sont puissants même en faciles et le fan service est suffisamment là. Coté histoire, on voyage sur plusieurs planètes, connus ou non et nos personnages sont sympathiques et mémorables. L'histoire prend son temps avant que le tout ne s'emboite. Et Desann, le méchant est le parfait modèle de ce qu'aurait donné un Kylo Ren bien appliqué: il a un complexe du fait qu'il n'a pas confiance en son coté jedi et après sa fuite il ne n'est un sith mais bien un jedi noir. Il veut remplacer les jedis par des guerriers.

pas le plus bon des Sonic, mais reste fun à jouer ! Les environnement sont jolie à regarder, tout comme les mouvement du hérisson bleu ! L'histoire du jeu reste en dessous des opus précédent et l'I.A. est parfois aux fraise.... Malgré cela si vous apprécier Sonic le jeu reste agréable à jouer =)

Título: Mutant Year Zero: Seed of Evil
Comentario:
La partida engancha con la del juego original y la verdad que lo esperaba con ganas desde las navidades pasadas.

Aquí os dejo mis PROS y CONTRAS (y obviamente el porqué del negativo)

PROS:

- Personajes carismáticos.
- Ambientación Mutant Punk.
- Sistema mixto tiempo real y combate por turnos.
- Básicamente si te gustó el juego base, sigue teniendo todos sus puntos fuertes.

CONTRAS:

- Precio MUY alto para las horas de juego (en 6hrs siendo generoso te lo comes)
- Historia floja, que para más guasa te da a entender que habrán más DLC´s
- Sigue sin mejorar fallos en el combate (cámara, IA,etc.)
- 1 personaje nuevo (bastante pocho) para seguir llevando un equipo de 3 integrantes.

Han tenido uno 6 meses para mejorar un buen trabajo que fue el Mutan Year Zero: Road To Eden y ha acabado dándome la sensación de un saca dinero y a correr de ahí, mi VOTO negativo.

Tenéis la serie tanto de esté DLC como de Road To Eden en mi canal de Youtube donde subo mis series desde Twitch y podéis juzgar un poco por vosotros mismo si estáis interesados, un saludo!

Título: Crusader Kings II: Sons of Abraham

Géneros: ['Indies', 'Simulation', 'Strategy', 'Multiplayer', 'Cooperation', 'Wargame', 'Action', 'RTS', 'Real Time Tactics', 'Base Building', 'PvE', 'PvP', 'Sci-fi', '3D', 'Third Person', 'Story Rich', 'Transhumanism', 'Moddable', 'Team-Based', 'Vehicular Combat', 'Colorful', 'Economy', 'Military', 'Tutorial', 'Tactical']
Comentario:
Quizá este juego es más conocido por usarse como una herramienta para "benchmarking" por tener la capacidad de poner de rodillas hasta a los ordenadores más avanzados, pero lo cierto es que es un excelente juego de estrategia. Es desafiante y una mejora notable sobre el juego original todos los aspectos, especialmente en la campaña, si bien faltan algunos detalles por corregir como el infame botón "Form Army" que no siempre funciona como se espera, aunque no perjudica prescindir de él. 

Por ultimo, el modo de juego en línea es la verdadera joya del juego gracias a sus modos cooperativo y de enfrentamiento y afortunadamente siempre hay alguien conectado esperando por una batalla. Eso sí, no se lancen a combatir contra otra persona a menos que ya tengan el juego bien dominado, o los harán papilla. 

¿Algo más? Pues si, en cuanto activen su clave en Steam, recibirán 2 DLC completamente gratis: El "Co-op Map Pack" y el "Juggernaut DLC". Bastante bien, en mi opinión.

If you want to be a manager this is your game. You can build your club from the ground to the best in the world. It is going to be hard and dark journey but it will pay off. It is everything you want from a football manager game!

Título: BioShock Infinite: Burial at Sea Episode Two
Comentario:
Amazing written story comes with twists and some flashbacks from the first two Bioshock games. There's no revolutionary change in gameplay, the story is filling the gasps from the Infinity. First episode is more of a rambo combat play and the second one required some sneaky stealthy tactics.

Everyone should buy this DLC once they've bought Bioshock, otherwise you're losing a lot from what the franchise offers.

Géneros: ['GeForce Now', 'Action', 'Adventure', 'RPG', 'Hack and Slash', 'Female Protagonist', 'Singleplayer', 'Action-Adventure', 'Violent', 'Open World', 'Third Person', 'Story Rich', 'Atmospheric', 'Souls-like', 'Dark Fantasy', 'Post-apocalyptic', 'Puzzle', 'Gore', 'Fantasy', 'Dark', 'Difficult']
Comentario:
One of the best games ever made by this studio and a more than worthy successor of Darksiders1 and Darksiders2.
There are so many puzzles and secrets and secret places to explore - its blowing my mind.
The game is kinda hard if you are not playing on noob mode (story mode) but you get used to it and you learn how to dodge and stike back enemies pretty quickly (atleast for me).
The Character level system is intuitive and fun since you have to earn souls by killing enemies and then sell them to Vulgrim to upgrade your level giving you a skill point you can spend freely on the 3 Attributes health, Strength and Magic, all enhancing the character in the long run.
The story is great and builds on the story of Darksiders 1 and 2.
The combat system is both very fast and agile, but unforgiving and you may end up trying to beat the same boss or mini boss over and over until you get it right, which makes it a great challange and adds to the fun of the game.

Géneros: ['Action', 'Adventure', 'Xbox ONE Games', 'Batman', 'Open World', 'Superhero', 'Stealth', 'Third Person', 'Singleplayer', 'Detective', 'Atmospheric', 'Story Rich', 'Dark', 'Comic Book', 'Puzzle', 'Mature', 'Sandbox', 'Horror']
Comentario:
Rough start but its current optimization state is passable and without huge FPS problems like it had.

Same game mechanics like any other Warner Bros. game - that means a lot of repetitive side quests but on the other hand very amazing main story game, too bad you need to complete some sections of side quests on 100 % to get the actual very ending.

The graphics are amazing and its top quality shouldn't bug the current average PC components, a very huge step forward comparing it to the previous Arkham games.

Combat is somehow better with a lot of options to stop/disable different types of enemies, it's quite repetitive but you never seem to get tired of it. Batmobile is very crucial to almost any mission, sometimes I ask myself if the car is the main character... Also I can't possibly describe how annoying and painful are missiles and the 1000 puzzles.

Oh and please do get a controller, you have no idea how much it helps.

Géneros: ['Action', 'RPG', 'Cooperation', 'Multiplayer', 'Adventure', 'Mac', 'Linux', 'Hack and Slash', 'Action RPG', 'Mythology', 'Fantasy', 'Isometric', 'Gore', 'Singleplayer', 'Online Co-Op', 'Violent', 'Medieval', 'Nudity', 'Loot', 'Local Co-Op', 'Top-Down', 'Dark Fantasy']
Comentario:
Vorwort: Für mich wäre es eine 79-80 Ich finde, viele Leute tun dem Spiel unrecht, es ist ein solider, unglaublich gut unterhaltender Titel. 
Ständig die Vergleiche mit Diablo und PoE, es sind Hack n Slays mehr haben die Spiele aber auch !!nicht wirklich!! gemein.

Ich habe jetzt 15 Sunden mit dem Spiel verbracht, bin noch nicht durch die ganze Handlung durch und hatte verdammt viel Spaß daran mich mit meinem Wikinger durch die wirklich schön gestalteten Level zu schlachten. (Ich kam ehrlich gesagt fast nicht mehr davon weg ;))
!Update:01.04.2017 (Kein Aprilscherz, leider)
Nun bin ich mit ca 25 Stunden durch und habe noch einiges festgestellt und werde meine Wertung leider auch etwas absenken müssen. Eine 74.

!Update 05.04.2017: Die Entwickler hauen einen Patch nach dem anderen Raus, viele Fehler wurden inzwischen behoben. Das Spiel wird also gepflegt und eventuell erweitert.
Wertung wieder etwas angehoben. :)

Grafik/Gestaltung/Technik:
Die Atmosphäre die das Spiel nur durch die visuellen Anteile aufbaut ist schön stimmig, und wird durch das Wiedrigkeitssystem noch etwas mit Nervenkitzel aufgebaut. Die Gebiete sind schön abwechslungsreich gestaltet. (Schnee-,Sumpf-"Höllen"- und Lava-gebiete)
Technisch ist es zwar nicht auf dem neuesten High-End-Stand sieht aber an den meisten stellen sehr schön aus (gerade die Schneegebiete). Animationen und "Gore-Effekte" sind flüssig und sehen gerade in Slowmotion echt schick aus.
Update:1.04.2017
Hier bleib ich dabei, es kommen noch ein Paar andere Gebiets und Gegnertypen dazu, die auch echt schön gestaltet sind.

Story/Erzählung:
Nun, das ist ein Punkt der mir als Liebhaber von guten Geschichten in Spielen am ehesten als Negativpunkt in den Sinn kommt. Gut Synchronisiert ist diese auf jeden Fall! Doch sie ist unglaublich platt und nur in kurzen Bildschirmtexten aufgeschrieben und Synchronisiert, es ist aber keine Katastrophe, nur keine komplexe Geschichte alla Dragon Age oder ähnlichem.
Irgendwie hat es aber echt Charme, es nimmt sich auch nicht wirklich ernst, was man an kleinen One-Liner Sprüchen des Charakters und kleinen Hommagen wie z.B. zu Herr der Ringe immer wieder zu merken bekommt, ich musste teils wirklich Lachen und das im positiven Sinne.
Update:01.04.2017
Von ca Mitte der Story bis ende überkam mich aber langsam dieses "Wann ist endlich rum- Gefühl", denn es wird dann doch etwas arg langatmig und öde immer noch irgendetwas "Zu besorgen". Das Ende war dann nicht wirklich das was man als befriedigend bezeichnen kann, aber endlich hat man es geschafft(^^').

Gameplay(und Skill-/Craftingsystem):
Das ist die große Stärke des Spieles, es ist simpel, aber es macht verdammt viel Spaß, gerade weil es so einfach gehalten ist.Gerade mit Controller spielt es einfach super. 
Spielerisch einfach große klasse, da Ufer ich einfach mal nicht aus.
Update:1.04.2017
Ok. Es macht Spaß, das auf jeden Fall mir sind nun aber doch echt krasse No-Go Punkte aufgefallen, Bugs die mich die Raubzüge nicht zuende machen Lassen, Gegner die nicht angegriffen werden und stellen an den ich hängen bleibe. Phu....und einem wird beim New-Game+ alles genommen, außer die Skills und Lvl (da hab ich sogar 2 geschenkt bekommen bis Stufe 30...machts auch nicht besser^^). Wirklich Motivation nochmal zu spielen hab ich nicht, leider da es eigentlich echt Spaß gemacht hat.

Zum Crafting: 
Man Baut sich sein Dorf aus dem Ruin wieder auf, Sammelt dabei Rohstoffe und Bastelt sich bei Rüstungs- und Schwert-schmied seine Ausrüstung zusammen, droppen tut natürlich während der sog. Raubzüge auch etwas ,moderat aber wenn dann ist es auch brauchbar. 

Nun noch der Skilltree:
JA! er ist kein komplexes 10 Quadratkilometer großes Mindmap, aber wer bracht das schon, wenn er sich einfach durch Horden von Gegnern kloppen will? Und dafür ist er trotzdem sehr Umfangreich, linear, aber Umfangreich und motivierend! (für mich in diesem Fall ein Plus!) Es gibt andere Spiele, da kann ich minen Character ausbauen und mich durch Tabellen und Guides schlagen, das kostet aber Zeit, in der man neunmal nicht wirklich spielt.
Update:1.04.2017
Wie bisher, aber etwas Spielerei am Ende wäre evtl doch etwas das dem Spiel etwas "Pepp" gegeben hätte. 

Fazit: Man hat Abends nach dem Arbeiten den Kopf voll, möchte einfach etwas spielen was nicht anstrengend ist (bis auf die Bosse, die haben Dark-Souls potential :), dann haut man sich so etwas wie dieses Spiel rein, hat Spaß, etwas Humor und schöne Atmosphäre. 
Gebt ihm einfach eine Chance und lasst euch drauf ein.
Update:1.04.2017
Aber nicht als "Endlos"-Spiel geeignet, da es da nach dem Durchspielen doch wenig Motivation bietet.

Título: The Settlers 7: Paths to a Kingdom Gold Edition
Comentario:
A major downgrade from the previous title.while the settlers 6 have many flaws this game doesnt remedy any of them. this game is a downgrade from the settlers 6 so i encourage anyone who sees this to play that game instead. hopefully the upcoming settlers 8 wont be as disappointing. on the campaign the previous games did the right thing in making the person you play as faceless and voiceless so you can make them whoever you want because the MC of this game is groan-inducing

the enter button is used for adding positive negative points below but also ends the review so ill just put it up here:

Positive points:
Building can have expansions that give a good reason to have multiple of the same building
The church is more then just a money button
Greater Variety in troops
Storehouses can be built
Expanded trade mechanic

Negative points:
Army control is linear
MC is insufferable
The general is a major downgrade from knights in the previous game
No exploration
Map contains alternate pathways that are inaccessible for seemingly no reason
Neutral territories have army presences
Citizens cant be directly interacted with
Clergy are made with alcohol which is a little offensive
Lack of a pause mechanic is felt far too vividly
Technology researched by an opponent is inaccessible to everyone else(this alone made me downgrade my rating another 10)

Une bonne extension! Le système nomade ajoute une nouvelle perspective au jeu et change du classique féodalisme, cependant je ne le recommanderait pas au nouveau joueur de CK2 qui risquerait de s'y perdre. Je pense qu'une bonne connaissance du jeu de base est nécessaire.

Simple, addictif et très bien pensé pour son prix et le temps de jeu que l'on peut passer dessus c'est clairement rentable surtout qu'il existe tjs le work shop et les extensions si on en veut encore. Super jeu

Le jeu est vide, 
J'ai le jeu Medieval Engineers depuis 07/2016 et j'y ai joué 20 Minutes,
Compliqué de saisir les contrôles et le principe du jeu,

Je préfère de loin Space Engineers du même éditeur,

Forza Horizon 4 ist lot better and nicer
Assetto Corsa (&Competizione) much more realistic

Observation ist ein absoluter Mega Titel! Die Story und die Spannung im Spiel haben mich quasi dazu gezwungen weiter zu Spielen... Ich kann nicht ganz nachvollziehen das hierzu noch kein Review geschrieben wurde.. Die Publisher haben es Verdient hierfür Lob und Anerkenung zu bekommen! Ganz klare Kaufempfehlung!

J'attendais celui-ci avec impatience ! Ayant laissé filer TGC PGA 2019 car je trouvais que ca n'en valait pas la peine. En attendant une année c'était la grosse surprise PGA Tour 2K21 arriva en grande pompes. Graphiquement très correcte le jeu apparemment ne demande pas trop de ressource de votre machine, d'habitude sur de gros jeux j'entends ma carte graphique tourner a fond, ici même avec les graphismes a fond , ca tourne très bien. J'attendais aussi qu'un système de clique pour tirer face son apparition, car on serait étonné de voir combien de joueurs n'ont pas de manette Xbox1 ou 360. Malheureusement cela reste du Golf Club tout craché. Fort heureusement cette version est plus facile a prendre en main et des options, beh c'est pas ca qui manque. Peut-être est-ce a cause d'un lancement trop hâtif, mais un bug récurrent est présent. Vous voulez voir vos replays ? Ben faudra attendre un patch correctif, car beaucoup de personnes ont apparemment le même problème qu'il n'ont pas accès à leurs replays. Ca la fout mal pour ceux qui veulent faires des vidéos youtube de leurs meilleurs swings. Malgré ca, ce jeu est un petit bijou. Les mauvaises langues sur Steam parlent d'une copie conforme de PGA 2019. Je ne pense pas que ce soit le cas. Un bon paquet de licences, des marques connues dans le monde du Golf professionnel et de vrais parcours de golf font oublier petit à petit la saga PGA Tour d'EA Sports. Fautes de licences vous ne verrez pas Tigerwoods ou McIlroy qui sont apparemment encore lié à Electronic Arts. Espérons les revoir très prochainement dans le prochain opus....

Die Grafik, Steuerung und Spieleoberfläche von Just Dance 2020 ist im Vergleich zum Vorgänger (Just Dance 2019) relativ gleich geblieben. Die Navigation ist recht simpel und es lassen sich Playlisten anlegen, damit man beispielsweise schneller zu seinen Lieblingsliedern tanzen kann. Es gibt natürlich wieder neue Songs bzw. Choreographien zum nachtanzen. Es ist eigentlich für jeden Musikgeschmack etwas dabei. Das Spiel macht besonders viel Spaß, wenn man es mit Freunden spielt, ist aber auch eine gute Möglichkeit, um sich selbst zur Bewegung zu annimieren. Negativ ist mir aufgefallen, dass im Spiel sehr aktiv Werbung für den kostenpflichtigen Abo-Service Just Dance Unlimited gemacht wird. Wenn man einen bestimmten Song auswählen möchte, muss man teilweise ziemlich lange weiter scrollen, um die kostenpflichtigen Songs zu überspringen. Es wird zwar ein kostenloser Probemonat angeboten, aber trotzdem finde ich die Werbung im Spiel zu aufdringlich.

Gesamte Bewertung:https://spielevz.de/just-dance-2020/

Great game, great graphics, good story, a worthy upgrade from FC3. A good co-op on a different path from the main story. Much fun to drive elephants. Needs at least a nice GPU and a 4-core CPU with 8GB ram to play smoothly. Great price here also!

Ich bin beim besten willen enttäuscht...
Ich hatte es mir am 16.01.2020 gekauft und hatte mich auf das Spiel gefreut.
Die Erwartungen die ich in das Spiel gesteckt habe, konnte ich nicht einmal auskosten.
Das Spiel sollte am 20.01.2020 erscheinen, wurde aber aufgrund von zahlreichen Fehlern auf den 21.01.2020 Verschoben. Nun ist es schon der 24.01.2020 und es ist immer noch nichts erschienen - von Infos habe ich auch noch nichts mit bekommen.

|| Ab hier Stand vom 25.01.2020 ||

Ich war voller Freude als ich um 16:30 Uhr gelesen habe, dass das Spiel nun zum Download bereit steht. Leider hat mich dieses Spiel aber in allen Bereichen enttäuscht. Man erhält zu wenig Infos Allgemein über die Situation im Spiel, in der er sich befindet. Man kann nur gewisse Gegenstände einsammeln und muss ohne Waffe, wovon es im Haus mehr als genug gibt, irgendwie diese 3 Objekte finden um zu Überleben. Das Spiel hätte richtig gut werden können, leider war dies bei mir nicht der Fall. Die Steuerung ist Geschmackssache. Mir persönlich gefällt sie nicht. Die Maus Empfindlichkeit ist für mich auch zu Hoch.

Es hat mich im Großen und Ganzen einfach nur enttäuscht.

['GeForce Now', 'Management', 'Mac', 'Simulation', 'Strategy', 'City Builder', 'Comedy', 'Sandbox', 'Singleplayer', 'Economy', 'Real-Time with Pause', 'Politics', 'Building', 'Resource Management', 'Political', 'Funny', 'Cold War', 'RTS', 'Atmospheric', 'God Game', 'Capitalism']
Comentario:
Tropico 4 is an excellent management / Nation builder game. The game is set on a paradise island, you play "El Commandante" a Gentle or Evil dictator : the choice is yours! 

The gameplay is classical, you manage different aspects : food, natural ressources, politic (inside / outside), economic, ecologic etc etc . The game set a funny tone, all the characters are stereotype and have funny dialog. I really enjoy the fact that you evolve through time (if you have the DLC modern times). There is a lot of things to explain about the game so I make it quick : it's really a complete (if you have all the dlc) and funny game, the only thing that misses is building tunnels and bridges (that feature is available in Tropico 6). You will stay on that game for hours if you like that kind of game!

The soundtracks is awesome and really fit and feed the global atmosphere!

Technically the game is great at maximum settings, even nowdays. 

Here is how it runs on a Ryzen 2700 and a GTX 1660 Ti : https://youtu.be/G8lXWvUYw3o

If you love management/nation builder games, Tropico is one of those games you need to have!

Comentario:
NEVERWINTER *fucking* NIGHTS

***SPOILER*** Questo è il mio gioco preferito di sempre, quindi scusatemi se sono di parte!

NWN è un rpg legato alle regole di D&D 3.5 unite al mondo di Forgotten Realms, la storia si divide in diversi capitoli che, anche se non mostrano una difficoltà esageratamente elevata, raccontano una storia degna di nota.

Personaggio non troppo difficile da creare, tristemente non troppo customizzabile, ad ogni modo riuscirete a trovare uno stile di gioco che vi aggraderà. Meccaniche elementari, tuttavia non da prendere sottogamba, i nemici possono diventare molto forti. 

Trappole, dungeon, storie, bevute, ambienti, suoni, magie, che volete di più?

L'ho comprato per giocare con i miei amici.
NOTA: nel gioco è presente un Editor, ed è possibile costruire i propri mondi e proprie avventure!

Título: Naruto to Boruto: Shinobi Striker Xbox ONE
Comentario:
Alors tout d'abord ce jeu va bien évidement plaire aux fans du manga. L'univers est très bien retranscrit, les graphismes sont plutôt bien réalisés, et les combats sont vraiment dynamiques.

Il manque quelques petites choses pour vraiment apprécier ce jeu, je trouve ( pour ma part ) qu'il manque des choses quant à la spécialisation de notre avatar ( je parle pour les jutsus ).

En effet, a la Ultimate Ninja Storm, le personnage dispose de 2 jutsus "de base" et d'un jutsu dit "secret". Sachant qu'il y'a 4 types de jeu qui sont Attaque, Distance, Défense et Soigneur. Je trouve que cela fait un peu léger, et le fait de ne jouer qu'avec ces 3 techniques rends les combats assez répétitifs, et réduit les chances de vous démarquer des autres joueurs. Encore une fois ce n'est que mon point de vue.

Le jeu est très principalement PVP. C'est la source principale d'xp, si je ne dis pas de bêtises ! Les combats se font a 4 contre 4, avec différents enjeux comme capture de base ou encore match a mort, a la call of ! A vous de créer vos synergies avec les différents membres de votre équipe.

Un système de maître assez complet, qui vous permet de choisir un mentors parmi les personnages les plus emblématiques de l'animé, qui vous apprendront leur techniques au fur et a mesure que vous gagnerez de l’expérience dans la formation qu'ils vous enseigneront. 

Notez que vous avez accès a un mode solo, qui n'est autre qu'un enchaînement de missions a faire avec votre maître, ou alors en coop,avec d'autres apprentis ninja :) C'est ce mode qui permet de déverrouiller les différents mentors au fur et a mesure que vous accomplirez es missions qui vous sont confiées. 

Voila donc un opus assez intéressant, plein de bonnes choses, mais comme tout jeu a sa sortie, encore améliorable ;)

Kauft euch lieber nen Brettspiel zu dem Preis, habt ihr mehr von.

Zum Release von Tekken 7 wurde einem bei der Deluxe-Edition sämtlicher folgender Content versprochen und das zu einem harten Preis von 100€ (ink. Vorbestellerbonus). 
Dieses Versprechen sehe ich mit dem zweiten Seasonpass als gebrochen, davon abgesehen war der Inhalt vom ersten Seasonpass, kurz gesagt, lächerlich. 
Tekken Bowling, merkwürdige Charaktere, welche ohnehin beim nächsten Tekken im Vergessenen landen und armseelige Anpassungsgegenstände runden die Traurigkeit von Tekken 7 perfekt ab.

80 because the game needs more to be perfect! better Ai, better physics, better graphics, better and more realistic riding styles, more custom things for the helmets and suits, historic tracks, and of course better multiplayer without this horrible lag

Let me start by saying that this game is the best at it's category until and for now. 

The GRAPHICS are top notch, making some landscapes very realistic. Making it seem more like a photo than a video game.
Optimised for high and low performance computers. I was able to play it comfortably on a low budget laptop.

The GAMEPLAY is easy enough to get the hang on and yet full and more complex than a normal racing game. Good enough to make you want to get back in the game even after months of absence.

The STORY is a fair one. Not too complicated, therefore easy to follow. But as an essential part of a game, the main story left me unsatisfied, waiting for more. Which it shouldn't. Therefore i give it a lower rating than the other 2.

Conclusion:
If you like racing games, this one is for you. There is no doubt. But as that - A racing game. You shouldn't expect a mind-blowing story because it focuses more on the experience of the gameplay.

I like the game. The game looks amazing and plays really good, I recommend trying it if you like this type of games.There are a lot of characters for you to play with so you will never get bored and also has many maps to chose from. Old but good.

n'achetez pas se season pass c'est du vol
acheter le jeu de base est plus que suffisant
l’Éditeur a choisit de séparer les dlc sensé être intégré à ce season pass, le seul dlc qui aurait pu être sympa... Le personnage Eliza n'est pas inclus et le mod proposé est le brawl de tekken tag tournament.

Ce jeu a fait un grand pas pour Blizzard, un seul scenario, donc plus de deux versions qu'on mélange ensuite. 3 factions qui sont cette fois réellement différent. Les portraits animés, les nombres d'unités a déplacer ou disponibles, l'histoire, l'ambiance. Bon ok, c'est très Space marines, aliens et predators niveau races mais on a aimer. Ce remake est excellent, une vraie refonte et en prime a redoublage et pour pas cher. Je rappel que FF8 demande plus pour finalement avoir fait pas grand chose

Título: Final Fantasy III + IV Double Pack
Comentario:
Ce double pack nous offre 2 bon final fantasy ayant subit premièrement un remake pour nintendo DS puis un portage sur IOS a partir duquel on a fait le port sur PC. il s'agit donc de portage de portage de remake.

outre cette fainéantise accablante de square enix et sa soif d'argent, on a quand même le droit a 2 bon final fantasy:

Final fantasy III nous fait suivre les aventures de 4 guerriers de la lumière : Luneth, Arc, Refia et Ingus qui s’en vont restaurer la balance entre la lumière et les ténèbres. Les combats se font au tour par tour, pas d'ATB bien sur. On a droit a 23 jobs différent (pour chaque personnages) incluant le chevalier oignon qui ne peut être obtenue que par une quête annexe. quêtes annexes qui peuvent toutefois buguer (vous ne recevrez pas les lettres les activant) et ainsi vous empêcher de terminer complètement le jeu et de vaincre tout ses défis lors du premier playthrough. Si ce n'est cela, ça reste un bon FF auquel j'ai pris plaisir a jouer et qui a une excellente durée de vie si vous souhaitez le compléter totalement, c'est le paradis du farmeur, ce qui est le cas de tout le FF quand on y pense.

Final Fantasy IV quant à lui nous fait suivre les aventures de cécil chevalier noir sous les ordres de Baron et toute sa clique. on a droit a un doublage horrible en Va mais heureusement nos amis les modeurs nous ont donné la possibilité de jouer en Vo. Ici l'histoire est bien plus prenante que dans le III, amour, trahison, mort... on fini par s’attacher a Cécil et à ses compagnons. les combats sont un peu plus agaçant toutefois, avec le chargement de la jauge d'attaque avant de pouvoir attaquer (oui je hais l'ATB). Ajoutons a cela qu'il n'y a pas de jobs, ce qui est un gros point noir pour moi. Au final ça reste un bon FF qui saura plaire à beaucoup de gens. 

Je met 90 a ce double pack ; les 2 jeux sont bon mais ont leurs défauts. ce qui me déplaît le plus c'est surtout les méthodes de SE qui recycle ses classiques datant d'une vingtaine d'année, avec le minimum syndical tout en nous faisant payer le prix fort.

Grand fan depuis gosse de MM après 5 heures de jeux, je suis extrêmement déçu pour ce qui est du graphisme ça va pour le reste il manque énormément de contenu je n'ai vu que 3 armes dans les jeux la grenade le nerf et le marteau pour le mode course. 

Chaque partie lançait en multi aussi bien arène que circuit vous vous retrouvez avec 10 joueurs voire 8 joueurs IA presque aucun joueur. on a fait vite le tour des circuits qui sont beaucoup moins attractifs et délirant que les anciens opus de micromachine. une fois niveaux 10 il me faut attendre 92 jours pour faire de la classer peut-être un bug je ne sais pas?

C'est triste de balancer en 2017 un nouveau MM qui est beaucoup moins bien que tous les précédents qui ne lui arrivent même pas à la cheville même la version smartphone à plus de chances d'être mieux c'est honteux.
TRISTE


De ChoCoNRV sur steam :Le côté "preorder/réduction" m'avait déjà paru pas net. Du genre on blouse les jeunots qu'ont jamais taté un MM de leur vie et en même temps on prend les joueurs old school par les sentiments en faisant bien attention à pas trop balancer des previews trop cramées...

Let me start by saying that this game is the best at it's category until and for now. 

The GRAPHICS are top notch, making some landscapes very realistic. Making it seem more like a photo than a video game.
Optimised for high and low performance computers. I was able to play it comfortably on a low budget laptop.

The GAMEPLAY is easy enough to get the hang on and yet full and more complex than a normal racing game. Good enough to make you want to get back in the game even after months of absence.

The STORY is a fair one. Not too complicated, therefore easy to follow. But as an essential part of a game, the main story left me unsatisfied, waiting for more. Which it shouldn't. Therefore i give it a lower rating than the other 2.

Conclusion:
If you like racing games, this one is for you. There is no doubt. But as that - A racing game. You shouldn't expect a mind-blowing story because it focuses more on the experience of the gameplay.

9 out of 10 IMO. As most of ppl already know, it's sim-cade game of 2016 season F1. 
The physics is not that hard to handle like assetto, iracing etc...but at the same time, it's in quite reasonable manner(+1 for the wet conditions). Career mode in level above expert+ is kinda tough in Full damage and w/o assist, however it's really well organized : D
And new interface and display looks better than the one of previous titles.

But I don't think it's well optimized for the low-mid range pc. i have i5-4670 / 8gb ram / 970gtx running on medium/high setup, and it's sometimes a bit laggy even though there's no other cars around me :/

Géneros: ['Action', 'Sports', 'Fighting', 'Multiplayer', 'Arcade', 'Adventure', 'Cooperation', 'Mac', 'Linux', 'Indies', 'Local Multiplayer', '2D Fighter', '2D', '4 Player Local', 'Competitive', 'Fast-Paced', 'Funny', 'Pixel Graphics', 'Local Co-Op', 'Online Co-Op', 'Singleplayer', 'Soundtrack', 'eSports']
Comentario: Ich empfehle dieses Spiel vor allem Leuten die Fighting-Games, vielleicht sogar der alten Klasse, lieben und gerne Spielen. Lethal League ist ein kleines Game für zwischendurch, was vor allem mit drei anderen Freunden zu einem unbrutalem Gemetzel wird. Die Grafik ist für diesen Preis sogar ganz Ok. Nicht jedem Spieler gefällt diese Art von Grafik, aber Spaß macht es trotzdem! Es erinnert stark an Smash, das natürlich mehr Variation beinhaltet, aber ebenso um einiges Teurer ist! Durch das Leveln erhält man Skins für einen der 6 Charaktere. Problem jedoch ist, dass es nur diese 6 gibt. Es gibt keine Möglichkeit sich mehr zu erspielen oder zu kaufen!

It's fun to start off with, but the game seems rather imbalanced and in the end I find it kind of a shame I got it. There is a story that features only the Paramount War from four different perspective. Kind of a shame it doesn't cover more.

Géneros: ['Action', 'FPS', 'RPG', 'Sci-fi', 'Story Rich', 'Third-Person Shooter', 'Space', 'Singleplayer', 'Choices Matter', 'Cinematic', 'Masterpiece', 'Third Person', 'Shooter', 'Romance', 'Character Customization', 'Atmospheric', 'Female Protagonist', 'Action RPG', 'Real-Time with Pause']
Comentario:
Excellent game, loved the story and the gameplay. The characters are deep and engaging especially if you played the other ME before. On the downside, there are definitely some fillers in the game which does make it drag on abit and should really be removed.

Graphically, the game is still good, not as great as some of the modern titles but has a very familiar look and feel to the ME universe.

The voice acting is superb as well as the animation. 

I did find however, after a while the combat to be a bit repetitive, it was fun to experiment with biotics at the start. But after you set up combinations that work, its rinse and repeat. Then again this is true of most games and you can change the game setting to a "story experience" to speed things up.

Definitely worth getting but please play ME1 and ME2 so that you have a continuation of the story if possible.

Título: Two Point Hospital: Retro Items Pack
Two Point Hospital: Off the Grid
Comentario: j'avais adoré thème hospital autrefois et là c'est une version plus actuelle de ce jeu et ce n'est que du bonheur ! il faut construire son hopital de A à Z en surveillant son budget, en formant le personnel, en faisant des recherches pour trouver de nouvelles maladies et technologies. Il faut penser à bien decorer, meubler, chauffer, climatiser chaque salle, tenir les lieux propres et mettre des plantes pour l'air. Celà ressemble un peu à un city builder mais là on gère un hopital avec des maladies improbables et amusantes. il y a un mode bac à sable pour construire l'hôpital de ses rêves. Ce jeu vous garantie pas mal d'heures d'amusement, peut être joué sans problème par des enfants,il n,'y a aucune violence, pas de sang.

Título: Need for Speed Heat Xbox ONE
Comentario:
The game is designed by greedy businessmen who force players to make a lot points in order to upgrade and buy cars. Doing normal races and (side) missions will get you no more than a few points. As I could have guessed there are hundreds if not thousands of videos published on YT. Videos contain glitches, exploits and shady ways on how to obtain points, this not only makes the new players vomit but it also makes them lose interest in the game.

Police cars are overpowered but that is to be expected. What is not expected are the demanded millions of points in order to progress further in game. If a player really wants to achieve the completion of the game then that player would need to farm points with numerous exploits published by YTbers (unfortunately the best and most efficient way to get points) longer than actually playing the game.

The story is absolute trash filled with dialogues that are in the same level of adult videos acting (p word is banned in this site lol). Feels like a denied concept of Fast and Furious.

Comentario: Ich habe Hello Neighbor sowie Secret Neighbor bereits in der Beta gespielt als auch in der vollen Version und beide Spiele sind meiner Meinung nach vollstens gelungen. Secret Neighbor hat als Nachfolger den echt lohnenswerten Multiplayer-Aspekt. Desweiteren sind Map und Haus größer als bei Hello Neighbor, man muss mehr Schlüssel gemeinsam finden und es gibt für verschiedene auswählbare Charaktere Skins und Kleidungen für Ingame-Währung sowie Echtgeld. Ich kann das Spiel jedem empfehlen und finde den Preis komplett gerechtfertig und das sage ich nicht nur, weil ich Partner vom Publisher tinyBuild bin.

Le jeu est très immersif. J'ai plus de 20h de jeu alors que j'ai acheter le jeu il y a deux jours.
Les mécaniques sont très intéressantes, loin d'être facile ce jeu est parfait pour ceux qui aiment les jeux de stratégies en tour par tour. Il y a environ 8 escouades, différentes et spécifiques, les cartes restent cependant les mêmes mais les parties sont (quasiment) toujours différentes. 
Si vous avez l'occasion de testez ce jeu, avant de l'acheter faites le! Ce jeu est vraiment sympathique.

Oxenfree major quality is the story. I was intrigued from the start by the interesting supernatural element which you discover by tuning your radio. It's super fun to change station and find creepy audios wherever you went.
While you progress with the story the social interactions give you the opportunity to build relationship with other characters.
The gameplay is super easy and the controls are simple and intuitive.
Definitely recommended if you want to spend time enjoying a thriller/supernatural graphic adventure,

Just don't buy it. EA is ripping you off. You think you pay for an AAA title?
Think again. This is absolutely cancerous:

- A singleplayer campaign of just a few hours long.
- Multiplayer that is 90% locked off and needs either 4600 hours, or 2100 bucks to unlock everything.

EA released an announcement that they will remove microtransactions until further notice. So now, your only choice is to grind for 4600 hours (have fun? I guess?). Which you can't grind, because you can't gain any credits if you play too much, with a 3 hour cooldown (which, if you wait, will be increased to 14 hours!!!)

Seriously, don't buy this game. Let EA burn to the ground. They promote gambling for children. They lock off 90% of the game's content, of which the only feasible way to unlock it is by paying more money, and even then you have no guarantee to unlock what you wanted, BECAUSE WHAT YOU BUY IS RANDOM. This is absolutely ridiculous. Stand against this nonsense by the WORST gaming publisher in existence.

Título: Monster Energy Supercross: The Official Videogame
Comentario:
Einfach ein gutes Spiel!
Die Grafik ist sehr schön, das Fahrverhalten fühlt sich gut an.
Allerdings erhält man keine "Strafe", wie in den MX vs ATV Teilen. Dort fällt man hin, wenn man einen Sprung zu weit überspringt.
Man hat sehr viele Möglichkeiten, seinen Fahrer und sein Fahrzeug zu individualisieren.
Alles in einem ein sehr gutes Motocross Spiel!

Sans plus ni moins, un nation pack de Wargame version steel divison avec quelques unités uniques et autres deck à construire selon vos stratégie sur le terrain. Pas indispensable mais bien sympa tout de même.

Frustrating game to play. Enemy AI sometimes just walk into the battle without engaging in a firefight. Other times, my own troops don’t know what to do and run all the way around the block to get into a building that’s right in front..

Título: Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands
Comentario:
Cuando salió pensé que el hype que sentía por la trilogía renacería pero la verdad es que apenas se quedó en un juego memorable.

Visualmente es una maravilla, muy bien diseñado, y para nada da la sensación de ser un solo palacio donde transcurre la historia. Con respecto al combate, si bien el número de enemigos aumenta con respecto a los anteriores, poco reto nos ponen estos enemigos ya que los combos son sencillos y fáciles de manejar desde el principio.

Le falta chispa y calidad con respecto a sus antecesores, hasta los diálogos son más pobres que en la trilogía. A veces me preguntaba si realmente estaba jugando con el mismo príncipe porque ni llega a ser el carismático de "Las Arenas del Tiempo" ni el duro de "El Alma del Guerrero", se ha quedado a medias, como un proceso de personalidad a medio completar. Incluso sería más chulesco pero con poca gracia. Este Príncipe sin duda tiene menos personalidad que los otros (trilogía y el juego de 2008 incluidos).

Aquellos que hayan jugado a Assassin's Creed no se les pasará por alto el guiño a Malik.

I've loved these games since the beginning. I haven't played in a while and this installment didn't disappoint me. I would have liked to see more animation or movies instead of long readings. I don't mind reading and I read everything in every game but times change and this game should be changing a little more with the times.

Das Spiel macht sehr viel spaß, doch verliert nach der Zeit den Spielspaß wenn man ein Level nie schaft. Durch die ganzen Easter Eggs macht es dann aber doch wieder laune mal eine ründchen zu spielen!

Aunque el contenido se termine pronto y tengas que compensarlo con DLCs, vale la pena jugarlo.El juego és frenético, tienes que tenr muchas cosas en cuenta a la vez. Puede llegar a ser repetitivo, peró en general és un jugo totalmente recomendable.

Great game, Star Wars experience all the way. All I ever wanted from a Star Wars game. Really engaging, great sound too. This is what I have been waiting for since Dice announced it. Game engine through the roof. Game is a great combo of Battlefield and Star Wars franchise.

moto racer 4 avec des graphismes datant d'il y a 10 ans, très peu de pistes dans le jeu, très répétitif, gameplay de la moto à la ramasse.
Faire une suite des moto racer c'est bien mais là c'est ridicule
encore plus quand le solo est bugué, mission bloquée écran de chargement infini
écran de chargement, les écritures ont des lettres inversées
le jeu fait 2.5 GO, aucun gros licence de jeu sortant en 2016 font ce poids en GO

C'est la meilleur version de BLOOD BOWL que vous pouvez trouver en numérique : la plus complète, et la plus abordable aussi. Chef d'oeuvre, selon moi, qui étais pourtant étranger à cet univers.

Les races de WARHAMMER jouent au foot en tour-par-tour... tout est dit. Violent, drôle, et assez aléatoire, c'est une vraie bonne surprise. 

Bien sûr, il est hardcore, rageant, cruel, n'y allez pas si vous êtes un susceptible ou un mauvais perdant.
L'ambiance est folle, les commentateurs donnent le ton, les replays assurent le spectacle, et la sauce sera bien relevée.

Vous aurez fort à faire entre les modes solo, les sessions locales sur le canapé, et même le online.
On peut également créer son équipe de A à Z.

Il vous faut juste UNE souris.

Le II est plus joli; mais bien plus cher, et moins complet encore aujourd'hui.

Alors venez défourailler.

juste mieux que le premier avec plus de cotes sombre et un personnage vraiment sans cœur une histoire intéressante quelque défaut mais sa emperche pas etre un bon jeu si vous chercher du gore c'est ici

Really a great game, love it , makes you learn history in a fun way, very accurate and detailed.
Would recommend to anyone who wants realism! Its made like Red orchestra 2 , buy the game support the developers. <3

Just Cause 4 is a TPS action game developed by Avalanche studio and published by Square Enix. It is the fourth game in the Just Cause series and the successor to its 2015 game Just Cause 3. A somewhat similar game to this one is Tom Clancy’s Ghost Recon: Breakpoint. They are the same genre, both are TPS shooter and you will find some similarities in the gameplay.
Just Cause 4 is set in a fictional South American country named Solis, which is home to some extreme weather conditions. The game has been launched at the end of 2018.

Special features
In this game you have a wingsuit which gives you some cool gameplay experience. You can go skydiving, base jumping and free dive with no limits. You will fight your enemies under some extreme weather conditions, including treacherous tornadoes and lighting storms. Also, a special thing in this game is that you can use the extreme weather events to your advantage thanks to the never seen before in-game physics.
The plot takes place after the events of Just Cause 3 when Rico Rodriguez is approached by a Solis native, Mira Morales. She convinces him to come to Solis to uncover the truth about Project Illapa. The projects scope is to create weather cores able to control the weather and create storms. Also, Miguel Rodriguez (Rico’s father) had a part in creating those. The project is run by the incumbent Solis leader Oscar Espinosa. He maintains strict control over the people of Solis. What you need to do is to dive into the South American nation of Solis, the homeland of the Black Hand and search of answers.

Graphics and art design
Even though the game still has some bugs the graphics will make up for it. The art design plus the graphics for this game make a good combination making it look somehow realistic with all the shadows and reflections. Speaking of the art design itself, it is very good giving the game a very tropical feeling.

Better that the Older Games?
This game still needs some improvements. The bugs must be fixed for sure, but after all this is still a good game. I can’t say for sure if this is better than some of the older ones in this series, but if you liked previous JC games, you will like this one for its story and gameplay. In conclusion, I can recommend this game for all TPS and JC lovers.

Reviewer: David UG

I love fighting games (unfortunately my skill doesn't reach up to my love) and Soul Calibur has been a favourite of mine since SCIII. Glad to see the quality hasn't dropped since. Glad I bought it. 
Only downside is the story mode: the english dub sounds a bit awkward and dialogues sometimes get so weird they stop making sense. 
But the overall experience is still very enjoyable.

Géneros: ['Action', 'Adventure', 'Linux', 'Mac', 'RPG', 'Strategy', 'Story Rich', 'Choices Matter', 'Isometric', 'Dark Fantasy', 'CRPG', 'Singleplayer', 'Fantasy', 'Villain Protagonist', 'Real-Time with Pause', 'Character Customization', 'Atmospheric', 'Open World', 'Turn-Based', 'Party-Based RPG', 'Female Protagonist']
Comentario:
Tyranny is an isometric, action RPG set in a medieval-fantasy period.
Now, you must be turning your heads away as this genre is quite over-
saturated of late, but fear not, as this game has one extremely crucial
and unique distinction. That is in the story. The premise of the game is
that a war has just gotten over and the “evil” side has won. Now you
work for this faction and are basically cleaning up the aftermath of the
war. And the big difference is that this game gives you total freedom of
your decisions. You can choose to be sympathetic and show mercy to
the people or you can show your dark side and be, as the name of the
game might hint, a tyrant!

*Be Your Own Villain*
This game offers you a very thorough character creation option. You can
choose to be an archer or a swordsman, a rogue or a tank and so on. You
can be whatever you want and customise everything to the tee. This one
feature in itself offers this game a ton of re-playability! Once you
finished the game as a frontline tank, why not try experiencing it as a
wizard? The possibilities are endless!

*Truly Freedom Of Choice*
As I have said in my opening paragraph, this game shows you the other
side of the coin when it comes to the classic tale of Good vs Evil. You are
on the side of Evil and you have to ensure the homeless people who
have had their lived ripped apart in the aftermath of the war are dealt
with. You can choose to throw them all to jail without reason or you can
be a merciful character in a world without heart. The choice is yours.
This is where the RPG element of the game stems from. You can choose to invest in skill points that will aid you on your journey or you can choose ones that might hinder your decisions but help you in combat. This is a vast and diverse system that is easy to understand but has layers of depth for more experienced players. The path is yours to forge!

*Snail’s Pace Combat…Yawn*
This game has a lot of positives but there is one negative aspect to it that
I feel has to be stated in a review, and that is the combat. This is real
time combat with the option to pause so you can micromanage your
party members and use their abilities. There is the option to have the AI
control your party members, so you can keep the combat real time, but
,as you learn more abilities it becomes harder to play using this, as the
computer may not target who you want to target or may heal the wrong
member. So the game immediately forces some amount of
micromanagement on players and on top of that the combat is …. just
dull and extremely slow. I don’t know how else to describe it. Some
players may enjoy it, but I can’t say that I did. Even players who enjoy
slower strategy games might not enjoy this game’s combat.

*Get Started On Your Path To Tyranny*
Now I have talked about the one big negative and that is the combat but
don’t let this deter you as the rest of the game is quite enjoyable. It has
re-playability through just the character creation, not to mention the
choices you will have to make. It also has a unique and interesting story
to keep you hooked. I can safely say that a lot of people will enjoy this
game despite the combat gameplay being kind of a let down.

Reviewer: Groiig UG

Título: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate Joker Challenger Pack Switch
Comentario: Joker es un personaje muy rápido y hábil. Es bueno jugando a grandes y cortas distancias. El escenario que trae al comprarlo es "Mementos", y tiene una gran banda sonora. Me he divertido mucho jugando con este personaje.

Super fun game! Massive props to Ubisoft for actually making a really great game. 
It really gives you different ways of playing the game, sneaky, guns blazing, just using your techs etc. 
A lot of different content aside the main and side missions. Haven't noticed any bugs or glitches which is great!

Comentario:
The Surge 2 is a very well satisfied sci-fi slaughter-looter soul like game, but like every game, it have down side.
Parry/Block control is not good when use mouse, recommend to play the game with controller.
Character customize options are too few, need more options.
AI sometimes just stupid, they only have high damage, even bosses AI are not smart.
Otherwhile, map design is very good and will make you surprised.
Parry/Block system in an directions is a very bright point of the game.
And use your strategy, choose the right weapon to fight with the right enemies, you will survive.

Título: Forza Horizon 4 Expansions Bundle (PC / Xbox ONE)
Comentario:
Ich finde die beiden Erweiterungen echt gelungen! Die erste hat eine tolle Atmosphäre und die zweite... hat Lego :D
Echt cool was die Entwickler da "zusammengebaut" haben. ;)
Das Hauptspiel, besonders mit Freunden, hat schon Spaß gemacht, aber die beiden Erweiterungen ergänzen das ganze zu einem super Gesamtpaket!
Mit dem Bundle macht man garantiert nichts falsch. Anstatt die beiden einzeln bzw. nur eins für 20€ zu kaufen, lohnt sich da auf jeden Fall beides für 10€ mehr zu holen.

SAO LOST SONG et un tres bon sur le quelle il retrace bien ALO mes dans une extension ajouter dans l'histoir les perso son varier on peux ce cree son propre perso donc sa propre histoire ce que je trouve cool ^^ on retrouve tres bien l'univers de SAO comme si on regarder l'anime aussi la pocibiliter de fly ca rend vachement le jeu plus libre le seul default au ajouter c les chargement qui son long mes sinon dans l'ensemble j'adore pour le 1er jeu que j'ai de la serie sao c bien le meilleur que j'aime avec fatale bullet donc si des gens hesite a la payer prenez les quand il sera en promo le jeu veau large le coup je vous le dit ^^ il et facile a prendre en main ^^

Título: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst
Géneros: ['Action', 'Adventure', "Beat'em all", 'Fighting', 'Cooperation', 'Multiplayer', 'RPG', 'Anime', 'Ninja', 'Controller', 'Singleplayer', 'Open World', '3D Fighter', 'Fantasy', 'Local Multiplayer', 'PvP', 'Third Person', 'Atmospheric', 'Local Co-Op']
Comentario:
So a few years ago- before I bought the game on Steam- I was bored one day and decided to play this game. Originally it was a joke, I was a fan of Naruto and Ultimate Ninja as a kid but as an adult my interest in the show was pretty much nil and the games pretty much met the same fate after a disaster of a romp through the demo back when UNS first came out (to say nothing of what I think of the latter now). So I booted up the game, watched the opening cutscene, and immediately remembered what it was that I loved about CyberConnect 2.

Ultimate Ninja STORM 3 is an Arena-style Fighting game that, for the most part, is pretty simplistic. The main draw of this game, as odd as it might sound for a Fighting game, is its story. Now, probably the biggest problem with Bandai porting UNS 3 specifically is that UNS3, despite originally starting before the events of the series, the game is mostly still a sequel to UNS2, and while the events are referenced and mentioned, it doesn't actually give any real form of a recap. This in mind, the Ninja Timeline lets you replay fights that took place in the past with descriptions, so if you do find yourself wanting to brush up on the story a bit, the option's there.

One thing that's worth noting about the game's Story Mode is that it represents what, to me, is the biggest selling point for the Ultimate Ninja Storm series: the presentation. I mentioned above that, before I played this game, I was basically pretty Naruto neutral. The anime's quality varied too often and had too many episodes for me to want to get back into and I just couldn't motivate myself to read the manga. I'd say my stance on the series had basically become that of the masses and it was just kind of...there. Along comes Ninja Storm 3 to practically sweep me off my feet thanks to CyberConnect 2's amazing cinematic direction. There aren't too many games I can think of that can present their anime titles in such a way that they really feel like their own, that they don't simply feel like a cash-in of a product that was more popular as an anime/manga/LN/VN/take your pick.

The Story Mode has a bit of exploration in between its cutscenes and fights, but for the most part, it's told in the latter two formats- after beating the story you can explore as you wish, so there's no real loss here. Though, when compared to something like Ubisoft's Rise of a Ninja series, the exploration here definitely feels rather lackluster. This is something of an unfair comparison, though, as that series was partially advertised for its exploration, but even when compared to the original Ultimate Ninja games (2 and 3 in particular), the exploration feels superficial during the campaign and unintuitive after all's said and done. However, it rarely lasts for a long enough time that it's particularly boring.

When a fight does take place, you will be taken to a menu that will allow you to ready your ninja tools. For the most part this is pretty arbitrary and it's unlikely that you'll actually use them, but it's an option. From here the fight will begin, assuming you aren't given an Ultimate Decision. Ultimate Decisions are points in the game where you need to make a choice and that choice will affect the fight. In a very brass tacks sense, this is just choosing the difficulty of a fight and if you know how hard you want it to be, you'll know which one you want to pick, usually. But this difficulty switch generally feels pretty tangible, and while the choice has no real affect on the story, it does affect the gameplay. 

For example, at the beginning of the game you're presented with a choice between saving going to protect the currently-under-fire Leaf Village or investigating the strange masked man that was at the scene. Should you choose the former, which is a Hero's Path option, you'll skip the first fight with the Masked Man and go straight to controlling the Third Hokage. In the Legend Path, though, you do both.This decision isn't always as simple as just skipping parts of fights, however. In later parts of the game, the decision can change the nature of a fight altogether or change it in smaller, more interesting ways. It's a system that could've been a lot more superficial than it turned out to be but actually adds a bit of replay value to the story.

As for the fights themselves, these are, as stated above, pretty simple. Combos are generally as simple as either attacking with the one attack button or attacking with the one attack button and also inputting a direction, and you also have a ranged attack and a justsu at your disposal, as well as a Secret Technique. If you're expecting a complex fighting experience here, there's not really much to see. Along with the combos being particularly simple, the jutsu (which basically just means technique), is merely a two button process, that's really all there is to the game. And while this might not sound particularly exciting, the various parts of the gameplay blend together rather nicely.

For the most part, it's a game about maneuverability. The various arenas in the game can be pretty large, but since you're ninjas you'll be jumping and dashing all over the place, and for the most part this feels pretty good. Being able to close the distance between someone and create a similar distance between the two of you all while trying to predict who will strike when so as not to use up your substitutions is harrowing. What are substitutions? Basically the most important mechanic in the game. Essentially, substitutions are a regenerating resource that lets you avoid damage by replacing yourself with an object (a log, usually). Relying on substitutions too much, however, will generally leave you with a depleted resource and no way to defend yourself from your enemy's onslaught. This isn't to say that substitutions make it impossible to maneuver effectively, as it's generally that type of thinking that leads to prophecies being self-fulfilled, but they certainly do play a major part in one's overall mobility.

Also QTEs. In Story Mode, after certain events, the game will go into QTE mode and you'll have to enter actions in time as they appear. Now, most people would generally groan at this, but those who have played the game will probably agree that QTEs rarely see better usage than how they work here. Once the cutscenes start, it's all gratification the whole way through, and you know you're going to be in for some eye candy if you do everything right.

For the unconvinced, here's a prime example of all of the above put to work.

Now, the problem with this fighting system, and the reason I recommend this game for its Story more than anything else, is that the simplicity of the combat can make it a bit tedious. Sure, online play (which works well but can be a bit wonky, especially when playing internationally) and local multiplayer is there to entertain you and there are a few small modes outside of the story to keep things fresh, as well as a bunch of unlockables, but all-in-all this is likely the type of game that (after completion) you'll be playing a lot in short bursts rather than for long periods of time. This isn't necessarily a bad thing but it definitely does leave more to be desired. I can't help but feel that more in the way of customization or just a little more depth to the battle system could really make the game a far more engaging experience, but after completing the game there really isn't all that much to do and it's basically best to just jump into Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 (because you really don't need to play Revolution. Really.)

Naruto fan or otherwise, this game is a great showcase of CC2's brand of cinematic excellence and writing and is a great alternative to the anime/manga proper.

Géneros: ['Action', 'Adventure', 'Xbox ONE Games', 'Zombies', 'Survival Horror', 'Horror', 'Gore', 'Remake', 'Violent', 'Third Person', 'Singleplayer', 'Classic', 'Atmospheric', 'Story Rich', 'Survival', 'Puzzle', 'Dark', 'Female Protagonist', 'Difficult']
Comentario:
Estamos ante uno de los mejores juegos no solo del año, sino de la generacion. Es increible como un juego de la vieja escuela pueda volver a hacer historia en los tiempos que acorden, donde los videojugadores valoran mas los graficos, la violencia, y el componente online sobre todo lo extraordinario que ofrecen juegos como este.

Resident Evil 2 es un juego que nadie se deberia perder, si bien se de antemano que no es para todo el mundo, es un juego estresante, agobiante y sobre todo dificil; es para aquellas personas que valoran un reto sobre otras cosas, por supuesto, un survival horror con todas las letras. Y espero que Capcom entienda de una vez por todas que este es el camino a seguir, no solo haciendo remakes, sino nuevos juegos de la saga Resident Evil o de otras sagas muertas, o incluso nuevas, pero de esta manera, sin abusos contra los jugadores, y con una dosis impresionante de creatividad.

Tan solo me queda decir ¡Bienvenido de nuevo Resident Evil! Y espero que esto genere una nueva ola en juegos Survival Horror de este estilo, que ya lo veníamos necesitando desde hace mucho tiempo.

Lee la reseña completa acá... https://aportesur.com/resena-resident-evil-2-xbox-one/

This is the Police 2 is a crime management game, where you takeover as the Chief of the town’s local Police Station. You are tasked with having to manage and take care of all the crimes that go on in the town. Nice concept, right? But does it live up to it?

Good Cop, Bad Cop
The cops in this game, have a mind of their own. If you are not nice to them then way you need them to pull through for you and maybe work overtime they won’t. And this is where the management aspect of the game comes in. Sometimes at the start of the game when the cops come to you with requests for a day off, or fewer working hours it’s good if you are able to give them that and keep them happy because later on when you have a barrage of 911 calls coming in, they will have your back and come through for you. But if you are a jerk and just make them work overtime from day 1 then expect them to leave you stranded when you need them the most. 

The game also checks your ability to weed out the bad cops. Some of the cops you get are just rotten apples. All they will ask for is time off and not really put in any effort. If you are unable to pick them out from the rest, then you will have a hard time at this game. But this is a fun mechanic as this game is primarily a management game.

Riot at a restaurant or just a long line?
Sometimes the game throws curve balls at you. For example, you will get a call about a riot in a public place but it will just be a large crowd waiting outside. You will have to be able to pick up on these small signs that tell you whether a 911 call is an actual emergency or a prank call. While this isn’t really that important at the beginning, later o, when you are getting call after call and can’t risk sending out officers for prank calls you better be ready. This is also taken to an extreme sometimes and breaks immersion. Some of the calls you get are just so unrealistic that it brings you back to reality that this is just a game. This is a small issue I have with this game, but it can be deal breaking for more hardcore players.

Same as the first game?
Well, not really. While it has the same systems, it also builds on those systems and improves them significantly. It also adds this new turn-based combat system that shows up randomly and only in specific firefight situations. And considering the price is quite low for this game I would say that they have done enough to warrant making a sequel.

Worth it or not?
In my opinion this game is definitely worth it. While it is quite a niche game, it also makes it welcome to newer players to the genre. This is a fun, little game that is also cheap. In my opinion the price fits the value offered and even though the game has a couple of negatives I have no issue recommending this fun game.

Reviewer: David UG

Massacrato ingiustamente dalla critica prima cosa a da 10 in giu questo va comprato per forza senza pensarci un seconod poi trovarlo a 2 euro è un regalo punto. Tecnicamente ben fatto fa il suo lavoro ed è godibile su quasi tutte le macchine. gameplay immediato frenetico divertente alla gears of war. Trama e ambientazioni affascinanti ricche di carisma. Unica pecca alcuni momenti co il rig ( robot con il quale ci spostiamo nle gioco) delle volte noioso spostarsi da un punto a l'altro ma sono pochi momenti. Per il resto scontri con nemici enormi divertentissimi tante armi e boss fight appaganti. CONSIGLIATISSIMO

State of Mind ne plaira pas forcément à tout le monde, il suffit de lire les reviews très manichéennes. Un produit qui divise de par ses thèmes et son univers auxquels il faut accrocher. Forcément, si vous n'aimez ni le sci-fi ni le cyberpunk, vous serez délaissés.

Certains reprochent la lenteur de l'aventure et le manque d'exploration. Seulement, il ne suffit pas d'acheter un jeu qui ne correspond pas à ses goûts pour ensuite se plaindre. State of mind n'est en aucun cas un open-world ou un semblant de RPG comme Deus Ex. Ici, on nous propose une histoire mystérieuse qui se dévoile petit à petit. Pas d'action ou de combat, on suit des pistes pour découvrir et révéler la vérité !

Je peux passer pour l'avocat du diable mais State of Mind est un bijou, fidèle aux produits de science-fiction dystopique. Il nous installe dans univers crédible avec des personnages attachants dans une trame scénaristique haletante.
Pour les afficionados des grands noms comme Blade Runner, Deus Ex, Asimov our encore Philip K Dick (pour ne citer qu'eux)
