While StarCraft2: Hearth of The Swarm was really awaited, I didn't expect that much at first place. 

The single player campaign will keep you busy and excited the whole time, while the multiplayer, which in my opinion is the best part of this game will make you improve with each game.

In all leagues you will find players matching your rank. As in Wings of Liberty, you will find ladder and non-ladder games. From 1v1 to 4v4, that includes games with A.I., which can be really challenging sometimes, but that depends on you and after some practice they will be no match for you.

You will enjoy the soundtrack and the good graphics. Also you may like the great 3D portraits of the units and the zoom option of the camera, which is not very useful during battle, but for watching replays, could be really nice. 
I cannot skip the great achievements that you earn with gaining experience in the multiplayer matches or trough the campaign, which adds another competitive thing in the game and unlocks new skins for the units, avatars etc.
The new units are really useful and with good balance, I really can't complain about that.

This expansion is totally worth it. and its a must if you are a StarCraft 2 fan.

Introduction
Safety First! is developed by JCO and published by Headup Games. Dev team’s first game release onto Steam, but I think they’re off on the right foot. The title in question is a parody of sorts, but one which doesn’t feel forced and can be quite a challenge to unsuspecting players. For its current price, I consider it a great deal.

Gameplay
Physics-based puzzle platformers aren’t new neither on Steam nor before it. And yet, very few of them mix humor with nerve bending digital acrobatics. You will fail Safety First! a lot, in fact. But you will still laugh at the outcome of your less than stellar results. The humor in this game, considered crude by some players perhaps, is still offering a new perspective upon a genre I frankly felt that I’ve seen enough of it already. The not-so-subtle Magical Yellow Repair Liquid or MYRL for short, is not central to the game’s “plot”. As long as you keep an open mind about it and have plenty of pacience at first, the title will entertain you for quite a few hours. Just do your best to play it with a controller. The keyboard layout only adds unnecessary issues to an already hard game. With several game modes to choose from that are unlocked as you progress through the initial levels, I find it a perfect incentive to be finally able to play the Drunk mode and fail in even funnier ways than you did before.

Not much can be said against or in favor of Safety Fist!’ looks. It could have been more lively, but then again, it acomplishes its purpose even with only a handful of colors. The soundtrack on the modes unlocked later in-game fits the mood and never felt repetitive.

Pros
+ Humorous approach to platforming
+ Level and obstacle diversity with several game modes
+ Steam Trading Cards & Achievements
+ Decently priced

Cons
- Tutorial or not, still a fairly difficult game
- Lacks chromatic variation
- Keyboard controls while responsive, not ideal

Result / Final thoughts
Don’t get fooled by its apparent simple looks and goals. Safety First! Is one of the few platformers in recent years that amused me, beyond the regular feelings of frustration that most platform games offer on a regular basis. It’s not to be taken lightly, any game that no matter how difficult instead of rage quitting, puts a smile on your face. You can even skip levels (“cheating”) so stop hitting that keyboard, will you? Use a gamepad and relax. MYRL fixes almost everything.

Rating 8/10

Muy buen JRPG. El juego tiene varios desafíos y una historia típica, con un sistema de turnos típico de estos juegos. Resalta sobretodo por el diferente sistema de combate, pues cada personaje tiene dos estilos y saber usarlos es la básica de este juego. Una OST mas que aceptable y un sistema de personalización de personaje en cuanto al leveleo muy entretenido y complejo a la vez. Una sorpresa para los amantes del JRPG que sin duda ayudara para rellenar esos días aburridos hasta que sale otro juego. 

Es muy lineal. Apenas hay misiones secundarias aunque eso si, te dan lo mejor para llevar a tus personajes a la perfección. Aunque al principio lo de los estilos es algo confuso, te lo explican todo mediante tutoriales que luego puedes revisar sin problemas. No tiene New Game + y por lo tanto rejugabilidad es nula. Tiene una duración de 18-20 horas si lo haces todo.

Comentario:
[TEST DE HALF-LIFE 1]
Je suis très satisfait de mon achat !
J'ai joué à Half-Life 2, je l'ai fini a 100%. J'ai trouvé ce dernier émouvant (seuls ceux qui l'ont fini pourront comprendre). J'ai donc acheté Half-Life:Anthology et je ne suis pas déçu !

This game is an absolute master piece: headcrabs,hunters, zombies, combine soldiers and striders everywhere! An incredible written story overall and great atmosphere, you will need to do some thinking to complete the whole game.
A crowbar, a gravity gun and a few other guns is all you need to complete this game.
Dr. Freeman is going nuts on the combine and the aliens!
Verdict? A must have in every gamer's collection.

Je vais pas être trop vache avec ce jeu. Mais je vais pas vous le cacher il a beaucoup de défaut.

Déjà, le plus agaçant c'est les quêtes, à peine on examine quelque chose, pouf ! Une nouvelle quête, donc au début t'es un peu à la ramasse parce que ta 36 quêtes en cours... 

En suite toujours en parlant des point négatif, il manque beaucoup d'animation comme un des bruits par exemple quand on equipe une arme ou un équipement, les bruits de pas sont inexistant aussi... Et puis c'est vraiment chiant quand on y pense il faut toujours marcher marcher et encore marcher... De plus il y a beaucoup de manque de traduction, des fois on chope des quêtes en russe... 

Bon et puis en point positif pas grand chose, l'histoire est bon, le scénario bof mais correcte, Unreal Engine 4 qui fait plaisir donc très bon graphisme, création de son personnage bien fichue mais pas encore assez poussé.

C'est un jeu qui est en accès anticipé depuis 2 ans, c'est un petit studio russe qui se lance dans le développement on peut pas leur en vouloir. Malgré que se soit un accès anticipé raté, le jeu reste prometteur même si c'est difficile à croire.

Descuento: No hay descuento para este juego :(
Comentario:
Ce jeu a toujours été très bien et u temps ou j'y jouais en ligne il ne m'a jamais fait ressentir la moindre déception. Seulement voilà... Depuis quelque année le multi a disparut, les serveurs ont fermé, je ne saurait pas vraiment dire pourquoi il y a des tas de rumeur a ce sujet... Je lui aurait mit 100 sans hésité si le multi était toujours là voilà pourquoi je ne met que 70.

Si vous chercher un bon jeu dans le même style que Diablo en terme de farm et de gameplay alors allez-y, l'histoire est intéressante, les graphismes sont très bien pour l'époque vous avez la possibilité de choisir deux classes ! J'ai toujours été fan du mixte Défense-Rêve qui a pour nom le templier ahah !

Comparons le toujours a diablo, ici vous avez aussi plusieurs acte, vous commencez le jeu en grèce, puis en egypte, en olympe (cet acte ne comprend qu'un seul boss un peu comme l'acte 3 du diablo 2 qui est très court également) en chine et pour finir en enfer !

A moins que l'olympe se situe après la chine... Je ne sais plus ^^'

Vous passerez sans doute des heures sur ce jeu, farmerais votre stuff et recréerais d'autre perso pour testé tout les mixtes possible de classe !

Mais jamais plus vous ne pourrez goûté au plaisir du multi sur ce jeu...

Je le conseil vraiment, pour moins de 4€34 (prix a l'heure actuel) le jeu + l'extention (qui offre le monde des enfers et la sous classe rêve je crois) ça vaut vraiment le coup !

Created by Giant Squid (a studio founded by Matt Nava, art director of Journey), Abzû unfortunately feels like it's ironically missing... a game director. Abzû is more like an early and lesser prototype of Journey; it looks like Journey, it sounds like Journey, but it never reaches the emotional and narrative heights of Journey. Abzû tries hard to mimic Journey without quite understanding what made Journey a masterpiece. It's often gorgeous but empty, meaningless. Even the music by Austin Wintory is seemingly made of leftovers from Journey... For all his talents and qualities, Matt Nava is not yet Jenova Chen (the acclaimed director of Journey, Cloud and Flower). But I sure hope his next project will gain in maturity.

Overall great experience, had fun playing and animations in comparison to the old ME are way smoother which is a big + for developers and game animations.
However story and side tasks are really repetetive, its cool how they improved the game but playing only to see same quest idea is a bit boring after some time.
Open world isnt that "open", jumping around is okay, you can learn new things and stay cool in the environment.
Spent already like 2h playing the game and it felt refreshing and fun, it makes you unstressed from the daily activities like work, school etc...
I feel really comfy playing the game, all that jumping and vaulting alone is a ton of fun, unstressing and relaxing in the same time.

Great game, after long time i am not dissapointed from a new game. I read reviews and then i was uncertain if buy this game or not. Reviews are totally wrong. It´s worth it . Best optimalization so far.

Gran juego de estrategia en tiempo real. Ambientado en la Batalla de Gettysburg, con un realismo, tanto en los mandos participantes, como en el campo de batalla no vistos por mi hasta ahora. Es una reproducción de la batalla totalmente fidedigna, con los mismos tempos que se dieron en ella y que obviamente van variando en función de los resultados de las escaramuzas y batallas menores, hasta llegar a las grandes batallas donde se decidió todo. Elige bien donde enclavas una batería, selecciona la unidad adecuada para protegerla, utiliza el terreno (una importancia absolutamente real), y disfruta de unas buenas horas de diversión. Tiene niveles de dificultad que lo hacen mas o menos exigente. Si lo pruebas y te gusta, tienes que segir con Ultimate General: Civil War, que es sl mismo juego pero mucho mas grande, donde el escenario es la propia guerra civil americana, no centrandose en una sola batalla. Si te gusta la estrategia buena, lo recomiendo 100% no defraudará.

Fe - Durchgezockt

Fazit: 
Als kleines Fuchsähnliches Wesen zieht man los um die umliegende Natur von den Ausserirdischen zu befreien. Mit Hilfe deines Gesanges bekommst du Unterstützung von der Umgebung in der man sich bewegt. Der kleine Fuchs kann gleiten, klettern, singen, reiten. Mit diesen Fertigkeiten meisterst du dich durch die unterschiedlichen Welten. Ein gewaltfreies Spiel welches durch die relativ einfache Spielmechanik gut für Kinder ist. Die Spieldauer betrug ca. 6-8h wer es ausgiebiger mag, kann auch die diversen versteckten Kristalle und suchen. Leider gibt es nach dem Ende der Story keine Beam-Funktion um in den entsprechenden Gebieten die Gegenstände suchen zu können.

trials games are always awesome. i played like every trial game there is allready and they always deliver. this time they gave it more of a story mode and some maps are on foot so not on a bike which adds a new fun twist to the game

In questi giorno ho macinato un po' di ore e di conseguenza mi sembra d'obbligo buttare giù due righe riguardo a come si presenta il titolo in questione!

Il gioco inzia con un uomo misterioso chiamato Endir appartenente ai Masked Tribe, tribù formata da forti guerrieri che lavorano come mercenari. Il tutorial infatti ci presenta questo personaggio accompagnato da un anziano proprio durante una delle missioni a lui assegnate. La prima cosa che emerge, oltre a bellissime ost composte al pianoforte, è l'assenza di emotività di Endir; all'interno del gioco ci sono scelte multiple di dialogo e finora tutte quelle che ho notato rispecchiano questa apatia dell'uomo, cosa che non è facile trovare in un silent protagonist visto che solitamente siano noi stessi a plasmare il carattere di questo.

L'anziano signore ci fa capire quanto Endir viva unicamente per svolgere le sue missioni, ma perchè questo? Ancora non lo so, ma spero venga spiegato più avanti.

Poco dopo aver finito il tutorial, il misterioso uomo mascherato riceve un'ulteriore lavoro da un tizio misterioso che consiste nell' uccidere colei che si immolerà per salvare il pianeta. Si narra infatti da secoli che l'unico modo per scacciare nuovamente le feroci belve dal mondo sia offrire in sacrificio La Prescelta del piccolo villaggio di Nive. Ella compirà un lungo pellegrinaggio insieme ai suoi Guardiani per poter arrivare nel luogo in cui questo macabro rito avrà luogo. Final Fantasy X e Tales of Symphonia wanna be? Vedremo.

L'ironia della sorte è che in questo caso non c'è nessun Tidus o Lloyd e anzi, Endir sembra davvero intenzionato ad uccidere Setsuna, la Prescelta. Senza troppi giri di parole, la ragazza gli fa capire che il suo Pellegrinaggio è importante e che prima o poi morirà, quindi perchè non accompagnarla nel suo viaggio piuttosto che ucciderla subito?

I personaggi finora incontrati mi sembrano tutti validissimi. Aeterna è davvero tanto waifu oltre che essere decisamente preoccupata per la protezione di Setsuna
Gli NPC pure mi sembrano personaggi interessanti!

I am Setsuna nasce con un battle system a turni con l'ATB, ma in chiave moderna e infatti non lo trovo per niente stancante. Oltre al classico attacco fisico con l'arma equipaggiata, ci sono le techs ovvero le abilità che cambiano di personaggio in personaggio.
Non solo, queste teniche possono incrementare di numero grazie a dei cristalli chiamati Spritnite (per i fan della serie Trails corrispondono ai Quartz) che ci permettono di imparare abilità passive e non.

Per il momento mi fermo qui, ma il gioco mi sta davvero piacendo~

Comentario:
Hat mir insgesamt sehr gut gefallen. Sehr schöne Grafik und süchtigmachendes Farming-Prinzip àla Minecraft (mit allerdings meiner Meinung nach interessanteren Szenario...).
Leider insgesamt recht kurz... Hab viel getrödelt und viele Entdeckungstouren gemacht und war nach knapp 4,5Std bei den Credits angekommen... :-(

It is a decent game with good physics, like astroids circling around your planet, but it is too short for me to fully enjoy it, as it took me about fourty minutes to complete it. I would say, buy it if you like short games.

Not a bad little TD that I wish I would have found earlier. Pixel graphics are clean and fairly easy to distinguish. There are spells that you can use. Some minor customization for each map/playthrough. But it is also limiting; you can only use 4 turret types per map. I wish is was all or at least 10... I like more choices.

Le jeu reste correcte avec son mode coopération en ligne.
Malgré les années passées, ce jeu reste un bon jeu pour des petits délires entre potes.
La possibilité de prendre les armes des IA permet de ne jamais être à court de balles, un bon point !

Este juego recibió una dura crítica tras la beta, pues con las prisas del tirón comercial se sacó antes de tiempo. Los gráficos no son lo que se esperaba y la ia es muy deficiente. Dicho esto debo decir que por su precio actual no esta mal. Esta traducido y tiene cooperativo para 4 personas.

Los puntos fuentes de este título son el modo coop en la campaña, la subida de nivel del personaje y el sonido. Por un buen precio vale la pena para jugarlo coop,pero la experiencia para un jugador es menos satisfactoria.

Si eres nuevo te dan un código para desbloquear cosas, no nos ha funcionado y además a mi se me borraron los progresos al ponerlo. Respecto a esto la posventa es nula y el juego sigue lleno de bugs tanto tiempo después de salir. 

Creo que este juego puede estar bien para jugar de modo casual o pasar la campaña coop, pero para los fanáticos de la saga que busquen un juego AAA mejor prueben el isolation

Título: Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare Legacy Edition
Comentario:
Don't buy it please. Just save your money. I knew it would be bad, but no this bad.

Don't get me wrong, the campaign was worth it. But still not worth 50 euros. Both the multiplayer and unfortunately even zombies is a complete joke.

On the other hand, (the main reason why I bought this in the first place), MW Remastered servers are horrible. I've had it for 2 days, and i've had a total of 2 proper full games. The rest either lagged out, or I lost connection to servers for an hour or more so I gave up and played something else...

Please, save your money, buy milk instead. It's less of a disappointment than this I 100% guarantee it.

Remember Harambe died for our sins, now that he's looking over us, use his guidance to resist buying this game for MW Remastered.

StarCraft 2: Wings of Liberty is the next game in the StarCraft series. If you are not familiar with the series, in this game there are 3 races that battle for supremacy: Terrans (basically humans), Zergs (some kind of insect aliens) and Protoss (some kind of robot aliens). As usual, Blizzard did a grat job at making this game and didn't dissapoint us. Both, the campaign and the multiplayer are excelent. 
The campaign storyline is thrilling and it is a great experience; you would want to play it more than once. The campaign is played with the Terran race. 
The multiplayer is just awesome; the 1v1, 2v2, 3v3 and 4v4 matches are intense, I would recommend you to take a shord breack after each multiplayer game. Also, there is a ranking ladder with 7 rankings (Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinium, Diamond, Master and Grandmaster) which will motivate you to play more and more, and better and better.

Fizeram algo estraordinario em relação a comunidade, quantos mais streams, videos e etc, fizessem, mais pontos ganhamos e ha "milestones" ou seja, ha premios para a comunidade, cartas novas, skins e etc, e nao custa nada, basta registarem-se e recebem uma key quando forem seleccionados (vao ser, pode demorar, mas vao)

Un gran indie, muy recomendado. Eres una chica (Muy a lo Kill Bill) que quiere vengarse de los ex-socios de su padre que lo asesinaron o algo asi. Tomas la piel de esta chica que es como una ninja espadachina, mezclando sigilo y un sistema de combate muy original y divertido (es el experimento que salio mal a square enix con Resonance of Fate, pero con un resultado genial) basado en... bueno... tiempo real? turnos? No se que decir, fiaros y probadlo vosotros mismos o si sois mas escepticos ved un gameplay en internet a ver que opinais. El juego, divertido y entretenido (Y que a lo mejor por su estetica no entra de primeras a la vista) tiene la gran contra de su duracion, que no es que sea "corta" perse, mas bien es un corta tipo "ah...¿que ya he terminado el juego?". No se deciros unas horas, a lo mejor tiene una duracion similar a la campaña de un shoter moderno. Esto lo compensa al ser muy rejugable; la historia apenas existe, asi que no cuesta nada volver a niveles ateriores a intentar superarte.

Esse jogo é muito divertido. você com a sua arma caçando os fantasma soltos. Os Gráficos são bons e a jogabilidade é boa, mas infelizmente não tenho esse jogo, mas pretendo comprar, vi esse jogo no YT.

Un bon coté old school,des graphismes agréables,simple a prendre en main, mais deviens vite répétitif. Possibilité d'ugrades, une bonne quantité de niveaux et des boss qui donneront du fil a retordre pour les plus courageux.

Géneros: ['Action', 'Adventure', 'Linux', 'Mac', 'RPG', 'Strategy', 'Story Rich', 'Choices Matter', 'Isometric', 'Dark Fantasy', 'CRPG', 'Singleplayer', 'Fantasy', 'Villain Protagonist', 'Real-Time with Pause', 'Character Customization', 'Atmospheric', 'Open World', 'Party-Based RPG', 'Turn-Based', 'Female Protagonist']
Comentario:
Tyranny is an isometric, action RPG set in a medieval-fantasy period.
Now, you must be turning your heads away as this genre is quite over-
saturated of late, but fear not, as this game has one extremely crucial
and unique distinction. That is in the story. The premise of the game is
that a war has just gotten over and the “evil” side has won. Now you
work for this faction and are basically cleaning up the aftermath of the
war. And the big difference is that this game gives you total freedom of
your decisions. You can choose to be sympathetic and show mercy to
the people or you can show your dark side and be, as the name of the
game might hint, a tyrant!

*Be Your Own Villain*
This game offers you a very thorough character creation option. You can
choose to be an archer or a swordsman, a rogue or a tank and so on. You
can be whatever you want and customise everything to the tee. This one
feature in itself offers this game a ton of re-playability! Once you
finished the game as a frontline tank, why not try experiencing it as a
wizard? The possibilities are endless!

*Truly Freedom Of Choice*
As I have said in my opening paragraph, this game shows you the other
side of the coin when it comes to the classic tale of Good vs Evil. You are
on the side of Evil and you have to ensure the homeless people who
have had their lived ripped apart in the aftermath of the war are dealt
with. You can choose to throw them all to jail without reason or you can
be a merciful character in a world without heart. The choice is yours.
This is where the RPG element of the game stems from. You can choose to invest in skill points that will aid you on your journey or you can choose ones that might hinder your decisions but help you in combat. This is a vast and diverse system that is easy to understand but has layers of depth for more experienced players. The path is yours to forge!

*Snail’s Pace Combat…Yawn*
This game has a lot of positives but there is one negative aspect to it that
I feel has to be stated in a review, and that is the combat. This is real
time combat with the option to pause so you can micromanage your
party members and use their abilities. There is the option to have the AI
control your party members, so you can keep the combat real time, but
,as you learn more abilities it becomes harder to play using this, as the
computer may not target who you want to target or may heal the wrong
member. So the game immediately forces some amount of
micromanagement on players and on top of that the combat is …. just
dull and extremely slow. I don’t know how else to describe it. Some
players may enjoy it, but I can’t say that I did. Even players who enjoy
slower strategy games might not enjoy this game’s combat.

*Get Started On Your Path To Tyranny*
Now I have talked about the one big negative and that is the combat but
don’t let this deter you as the rest of the game is quite enjoyable. It has
re-playability through just the character creation, not to mention the
choices you will have to make. It also has a unique and interesting story
to keep you hooked. I can safely say that a lot of people will enjoy this
game despite the combat gameplay being kind of a let down.

Reviewer: Groiig UG

Another Hitman game in the series. Honestly, I have never played Hitman: Blood Money or that older one, but this game appealed to me. This is one of the best last-generation stealth games ever made. 

Graphics is really good. You can run the game even on older machines on decent quality. Sometimes I was quite surprised that the game looks so good. Optimalization isn´t bad too.

Environment is dynamic, interesting and polished. In whole game you´ll visit a lot of nice places. Sometimes I found myself just looking around and getting screenshots.

Gameplay is smooth, with decent animations and I enjoyed it by far. The game isn´t for impatient players. You have to try different strategies, be concentrated and you have to think.

Story isn´t very interesting. I am sure it will be familiar for you - serial killer is betrayed and he wants to execute a revenge.

Overall, it is really good stealth game. For those who are looking for exceptional story, you won´t find it in this game. But for others - go for it. I would RECOMMEND this game.

Comentario:
The game's story itself leaves much to be desired, most players will feel disconnected and un-immersed with the game's story, however it's visuals and depiction of New York is extremely well done, combined with echos (fragments of past events) help create a more better experience. The game's combat system is fluid and fast paced with customisable play-styles. 
Overall, a fun game to play with friends, however it does get repetitive fairly fast and the PvP balance is a bit out of place. Would not recommend if you're looking for a solo experience.

Id: Heaven´s Hope
Descuento: Worldwide

Géneros: ['Management', 'Mac', 'Simulation', 'Strategy', 'City Builder', 'Comedy', 'Sandbox', 'Singleplayer', 'Economy', 'Real-Time with Pause', 'Politics', 'Building', 'Resource Management', 'Political', 'Funny', 'Cold War', 'RTS', 'Atmospheric', 'God Game', 'Capitalism']
Comentario:
Tropico 4 is an excellent management / Nation builder game. The game is set on a paradise island, you play "El Commandante" a Gentle or Evil dictator : the choice is yours! 

The gameplay is classical, you manage different aspects : food, natural ressources, politic (inside / outside), economic, ecologic etc etc . The game set a funny tone, all the characters are stereotype and have funny dialog. I really enjoy the fact that you evolve through time (if you have the DLC modern times). There is a lot of things to explain about the game so I make it quick : it's really a complete (if you have all the dlc) and funny game, the only thing that misses is building tunnels and bridges (that feature is available in Tropico 6). You will stay on that game for hours if you like that kind of game!

The soundtracks is awesome and really fit and feed the global atmosphere!

Technically the game is great at maximum settings, even nowdays. 

Here is how it runs on a Ryzen 2700 and a GTX 1660 Ti : https://youtu.be/G8lXWvUYw3o

If you love management/nation builder games, Tropico is one of those games you need to have!

Meiner Meinung für Liebhaber der Serie, oder andere 4X Games ein wirklich genialer Titel. War anfangs sehr skeptisch, da das Spiel natürlich noch nicht fertig ist, aber alleine in der kurzen Zeit in der ich das Spiel nun habe, sind bereits so große Fortschritte gemacht worden, dass ich wirklich verblüfft war. Es sind 3 neue Rassen hinzugefügt worden, eine Menge Bugfixes und UI-Verbesserungen vorgenommen worden und einiges mehr.

Insgesamt kann man sagen, dass es wirklich großes Potenzial hat, aber noch etwas Zeit braucht um sich wirklich zu entwickeln. Trotzdem kann man sich bereits jetzt für Tage in dem Spiel und den fast unendlichen Möglichkeiten auf einen Sieg verlieren. Für Liebhaber und Nostagiker wirklich großartig, für Neueinsteiger fehlt noch einiges für die Einführung.

Voilà des années que nous sommes pour la plupart familiarisés aux sims, ces personnages à incarner dans leur vie de tous les jours pour une simulation plus vraie que nature lors de péripéties rocambolesques. Mais avec les Sims Médiéval, EA fait sortir l'univers déjà bien connu par la communauté de ses habitudes somme toute contemporaines pour les téléporter au temps des chevaliers. Si l'approche pouvait paraître un brin farfelue en premier temps, la sauce prend relativement bien et on se surprend même à aimer ça. Plus appréhendé ici sous un angle différent puisque le but est davantage de superviser et développer le monde où ils vivent que de les incarner dans un environnement déjà totalement établi, ce jeu nous offre une nouvelle manière de découvrir ou redécouvrir les sims.

Il faudra prendre néanmoins certaines choses en compte avec cet opus car même s'il s'agit d'un jeu estampillé "sims", le gameplay se retrouve bien plus épuré et centré sur les personnages, le royaume et les objectifs que sur la personnalisation et la simulation de vie pure. En d'autres termes, si vous êtes bien aux commandes d'un personnage que vous aurez défini de vous-même, vous devrez suivre la barrière de construction de l'histoire : vous débutez dans un royaume qui aura besoin d'un roi, d'un chevalier, d'un forgeron, marchand, médecin, etc. Et ces 10 personnages indispensables, c'est vous qui devrez les incarner à tour de rôle, étape par étape et en fonction des missions proposées lorsque vous en terminez une. Les bâtiments et décors sont eux redécorables mais vous devrez vous contenter de structures déjà installées, impossible de modifier votre maison ou château pour y rajouter des pièces, des étages ou en changer la disposition pure vous ne pourrez que retapisser les murs et installer les meubles qui vous conviennent.

Pour faire prospérer votre royaume, vous devrez remplir des quêtes dans la peau de vos héros, parfois avec la possibilité d'en choisir l'un ou l'autre, ce qui influencera le déroulement de celle-ci. La réalisation de ces objectifs vous permettra de débloquer davantage de lieux et donc de personnages qui y sont liés. Plus vous en débloquerez, plus votre domaine sera peuplé et florissant. Il vous faudra également traiter avec les royaumes voisins pour établir une paix durable ou repousser des envahisseurs à l'aide de l'épée, logique si l'on s'en tient à la thématique médiévale.

Magie et humour sont également au rendez-vous pour égailler un peu plus ce thème qui aurait pu sembler trop sérieux, il n'est d'ailleurs par rare que les missions à remplir soient carrément loufoques. (les chinchillas en prennent par ailleurs pour leur grade assez souvent). Les personnalités des sims rajoutent également un peu de piquant à l'aventure puisque vous devez nécessaire lui donner des qualités ET des défauts, vous retrouvant donc parfois avec des sims lubriques, ivrognes, solitaires, avides de sang, j'en passe et des meilleures. Les romances sont toujours de mise ainsi que la possibilité de faire prospérer votre arbre généalogique. 

Niveau visuel, sans avoir un ordinateur "bête de compétition" le rendu est correct et fluide, à l'image des opus de la licence et sachant que le jeu est sorti en 2011, il aura donc probablement prit un peu d'âge à vos yeux si vous ne vous y intéressez que maintenant. J'ai pu constater qu'il était mieux supporté que les Sims 3, sans doute à cause des différences de gameplay qui allègent le contenu (pas besoin d'une montagne d'outils pour les maisons puisqu'elles sont réduites au minimum). Il est également un peu en dessous de celui-là en terme de qualités des graphismes.

En conclusion, les Sims Médieval peut s'avérer assez plaisant à jouer si l'on est plus porté sur le côté "aventure/objectifs" que la simulation pure des autres titres mais son individualité reste assez intéressante même si l'on n'y retrouve pas des éléments qu'on aurait pu également apprécier ici. L'humour reste très présent et l'intérêt va en grandissant. La durabilité est plutôt bonne, une partie impliquant de suivre le récit de plusieurs protagonistes et une évolution d'un domaine sur plusieurs niveaux, ça reste au final assez conséquent.

Título: The Sims: Medieval Pirates and Nobles
Comentario:
DLC très bien. Intéressant à jouer. Hâte de tester plus en profondeur. J'ai déjà pu voir les possibilités supplémentaire apportées, elles sont vraiment bien. Je regrette juste le manque d'objet de décoration. Il y en a, mais dans certaines sections je pense qu'il pourrait y en avoir plus. Par exemple en "jeu" il n'y a que le jeu d'échecs customiser "pirate", ça aurait été sympa d'avoir des jeux vraiment typique (comme du lancé de couteaux par exemple) et aussi des jeux version nobles, ce que nous n'avons pas à part cux de base.
A part ça, pour le prix d'origine du DLC, c'est très bien.

Juego muy soso y aburrido, es más una aventura gráfica con gráficos 2D del 2000, no tiene nada que ver con RPG y la historia es un poco incoherente e infantil.

Es una aventura que tiene toda la pinta de estar diseñado para tablets, no es RPG de espada, magia y subida de nivel.

Ce jeu est très fun, il y a beaucoup de personnage le gameplay est très fun mais un gros point négatif : la durée de vie, en 1 heure j'ai fini le jeu donc voila. Mais sinon il mérite le prix il est vraiment bien, je le conseille vraiment.

Título: Street Fighter V Season 1 Character Pass
Comentario:
Well guys, what to say about Street Fighter V?
First of all i'd like to say despite the log in issues and connection errors during launch day i can't say i'm not happy about this game. Instead i have to honestly say i really like the animations, the colours, the way this game feels and plays (i'm not a pro player) and i won't say it's as hard to master than the previous one(s) but i bet it's still challenging yet more inviting for novices that are new to Street Fighter of fighting based games in general. 
What about the content?
Well, the Story Mode has been largely cut into chapters (1-4 fights instead of 1-10 per character) and that isn't much tbh, but who knows what they might add as free updates/content etc in due time? At least I want more of this game!!! :)
The main attraction is still the Multiplayer aspect of this game and it clearly shows that from the start so people who expected a huge single player story or arcade mode might be a bit displeased by that not being much or even missing within the current vanilla SF5 game.. 
However guys, there's still plenty of goodness to enjoy with this game and i recommend others to give i a try as well. 
My connection seems very stable atm (60fps) and my specs are i7 4790k, W7 x86, 32RAM, GTX 970FTW+

A ne pas confondre avec un disque additionnel qui rajoute des fonctionnalités au jeu original, les kits d'extension rajoutent des objets avant tout. C'est le cas de Vie Citadine. Il s'agit du 4ème kit d'extension pour les Sims 3 avec comme principal thème, je vous le donne dans le mille : le quotidien des citadins !

Comme à chaque extension, vous retrouverez de nombreux terrains préconstruits comme par exemple une salle de sport ou encore une laverie. Du côté des objets on retrouve également des nouveautés encore jamais vues comme des jeux d'extérieur pour aires de jeux mais également des variantes d'objets déjà présents comme de nouveaux sèches linge et machines à laver, ainsi que des appareils de sports sophistiqués. Et n'oublions pas les nouvelles tenues qui, il faut le souligner, restent néanmoins extrêmement banales.

Cet add-on n'apporte aucun changement notable dans le fonctionnement du jeu mais égaye la vie de vos sims, et de rentrer volontairement dans une routine citadine (aller laver son linge, accompagner ses enfants dans le jardin public, aller à la salle de sport tous les soirs après le travail). Bref, vos sims sont de vrais citadins maintenant !

A noter qu'il s'agit selon les sondages du 4ème kit préféré des joueurs.

Id: The Sims 3: Katy Perry’s Sweet Treats
Descuento: Europe

Comentario:
Este DLC fue lo que le puso la guinda al pastel de Dragon Age Inquisition.

En este dlc volvemos a ver a nuestros compañeros y jugamos con ellos, sabremos qué tal están después de 2 años y cómo les va en la vida. Pero lo mejor de todo es en el proceso: una de las decisiones que tuvimos que hacer durante el juego principal tomará su mayor repercusión aquí (y si cierto PJ está presente en ese instante es aún mejor). Añado además que las dos decisiones finales del juego nos ponen en situación para el siguiente juego.

Podremos visitar La Encrucijada (The Crossroads) que, para mi sorpresa durante una segunda visita con otro personaje, cambia dependiendo de la raza en los colores. Los lugares a investigar han sido bellamente diseñados, algunos me quedaría horas observándolos. También hay puzles y mucha información nueva, y el Áncora de la mano también dará nuevas "habilidades" (si se le puede llamar de esa manera).

La música es sublime, mucho mejor que la del juego principal y muy emotiva. Rivaliza en algunas pistas con la del dlc "Descenso" pero sin duda la supera. Sobre todo, me sorprendió muchísimo darme cuenta de que casi cada instrumento o familias de instrumentos en este DLC marcan quién es cada personaje. Ejemplo: tambores = qunari. ¡Impresionante! ¡hasta la música te cuenta todo! ¡Y hay dos canciones de taverna nuevas! 

Muchos se quejaron en su momento de que no debería haber salido como DLC sino que debería haber estado en el juego, la realidad es que no se pretendió hacer un dlc ya que esto estaba pensado que ocurriese en el siguiente juego; posteriormente se dijo que no, se cortó y, para que los jugadores entendiesen qué ocurría, lo añadieron como dlc. A pesar de que éste es un final (UNO) para DAI (que ya tuvo su cierre, abierto, sí, pero lo tuvo), creo que habría sido más imprescindible que el DLC "Legacy" de DA2 estuviera como "obligatorio" o dentro del propio juego (ya que el villano es directamente el de DAI) que éste dlc "Tresspasser".

100% recomendado!!!

Absolutely terrible game, controls feel unresponsive and there are loads of twitchy sections in the levels where if split second timing isn't perfect it is instant death. Bosses are just learn the patterns and dodge, usually you will used the skill you gain in a level to best them.

If you love the old Megaman game then but the Capcom Megaman collections rather than this.

Comentario:
N'ayan pas jouer au premier du nom n'étant pas attirer par les graphisme, je me suis laisser tenter par le 2 et je ne le regrette absolument pas ! Se jeux a vraiment tout pour plaire. 

Le jeux ne se prend pas la tête sur une quelconque stratégie ou autre, c'est un jeux somme toute dans un principe de fonctionnement tout simple, on a un vaisseaux, on améliore ou crée de nouvelle arme, on suis les quète, on gagne de l'argent, on combat, on achète de meilleur vaisseaux, en soit le principe de base est simple.

L'histoire est intéressante, sans être exceptionnelle, les combat sont très beaux, immersif et parfois tactique, le choix des armes est large, le choix des vaisseaux encore plus, et le système de récupération de plan pour ensuite crée des arme, chasseur ou amélioration encore plus puissante est vraiment sympas. Le système qui permet d'améliorer chaque facette du vaisseaux ( comme les bouclier, les arme, les réacteur ) est aussi très interessante.

Se que se jeux a de plus, c'est le fait de pouvoir récupérer les vaisseau adverse en les abordant et en les ramenant a une station spacial ou une base, qui nous demande de vendre ou de garder le vaisseau. On peut aussi choisir de se faire accompagner par 2 mercenaire qui combattrons a nos cotée et de lancer 3 escadrille de chasseur. On a aussi la possibiliter de traquer des '' héro '' qui rapporte une grosse prime a chaque héro abattue, avec une difficulté plus ou moins élevée.

Les 2 DLC du jeux rajoute a eux seul beaucoup de contenue.

Seuls points négatifs pour moi, les mercenaire qu'on engage reste trop loin du vaisseau et intervienne trop lentement, quelque beug très perturbant bien que vraiment rare ( le vaisseau du joueur qui se détruit sans aucune raison avec la vie pleine ), la trop grande faciliter a vendre les arme rare par erreur et enfin, le fait que le jeux devienne assez restreins une fois que tout est fait, même si c'est très long a faire.

En bref un jeux que je conseille vraiment au fan de combat galactique, au fan de grande variéter de vaisseaux et a ceux qui aime les combat sans prise de tête.

StarMade est on va dire correct.

Sa prise en main est en fait très complexe pour quelqu'un qui vient d'arriver sans avoir vu de vidéos auparavant ou qu'il n'avait pas joué dans la version gratuite du jeu quand elle était disponible.

Le jeu est cependant très complet, et très vaste, je ne saurai dire la taille, car cela dépend du serveur, des constructions qui ont été faites.
Oui, construction car c'est vous qui construisez le monde de StarMade, à travers les matériaux que vous récupérez sur les planètes, vous pourrez construire des stations, des vaisseaux et j'en passe.

La communauté est vaste également, et bizarrement on tombe souvent sur ce qu'on aime appeler les "Jean-Kévin", à savoir pourquoi...

Pour moi à cause de la complexité de la chose, car il faut vraiment s'y mettre quasi à 100%, je met un 60, car c'est très rebutant pour les nouveaux joueurs qui débutent, et pourtant, j'étais un ancien joueur de la version gratuite.

J'ai acheter se DLC pour but avoir plus de contenu dans Battlefield 3. Et ne je suis pas déçus du tout ! Comme d’habitude le jeu reste toute fois magnifique, le moteur graphique FrostBite 2 à des graphismes toujours hallucinant ! Vous aller reprendre gout au jeu. On retrouve 10 nouvelles arme de Battlefield 2 se qui et très bien ! On peux retrouver des nouveaux défis et des emblèmes. Enfin pour tout vous dire que vous aller améliorés votre expérience de jeux. Ce DLC et pour moi l'un des meilleurs de Battlefield 3.

Pour le mieux quand vous faite des parties de 64 joueur, vous aller tout de suite vous amusez et vous plongez dans le gameplay. Vous aurez du mal à sortir du jeux même dans les repas.

Pour le prix je ne vais pas me plaindre ! C'est très très correcte. Acheter le DLC si vous avez Battlefield 3, sans hésiter bien-sûr. Merci Instant-Gaming !! Pour cette achat rapide et à petit prix.

One Finger Death Punch is a fast-paced simple fighting game. It goes around kung-Fu battles with varying modes and styles. It is a game based on attacking and wrecking. A brawler where you punch left or punch right. Rhythm game-like, but with no rhythm. The actual rhythm comes with the fighting where every click is an actual attack.
The player needs to attack when the enemy is in the range of the attack. The ranges change depending on how well you are doing. So if you combo enough the range gets bigger and may let you do a charge move. Weapons give you extra range too.

*Story*
The game basically goes around a solo fighting stickman that battles hundreds of enemies advancing in chronological order. The game is easy to learn and but pretty much challenging to master. Well as a matter of fact the game cannot be mastered since you always are prone to hit one extra button by mistake. You start as a student. After several levels you unlock master levels where it gets harder. After master is completed, you unlock grandmaster where the difficulty is maxed out and the gameplay gets to its extreme. Can you make it from a student all the way to a grandmaster?

*Controls*
Speaking of the control configuration, they are pretty much the simplest ones out there; LMB to attack left, RMB to attack right. That's all of it.

*Graphics*
As an overview of the game's graphics, they are decent for an indie game. What's cool is that some objects in the background can be used to kill opponents. Some opponents are kicked into tables or walls that are in the background and break them. Some killings have cinematics like breaking the skull that happens in slow motion and lets you take a breath from the fight and enjoy the sound of the breaking.

*Skills*
Skills can be acquired by reaching a certain level and playing it. Some skills are cool and important to the fights and some are just there for no important reason.

*The enemies*
First comes the basic ones. The ones that can be one shot. Those ones aren’t a big deal. A simple LMB or RMB and you’re done with them. No matter how many they are and how frequent they come, if all the enemies are like basics, you can ace the battle with a 10/10 health.
Second comes the dodgers. Those ones come tricky since in the middle of the fight, you get one that needs to be hit one to the left then ones to the right. It might not be a problem, but with high speed and high frequency of enemies, those ones are damned. Some of the dodgers come of three hits or four hits. ( 3 hits as in L-R-L for example and 4 hits as in R-L-R-L)
Third comes the tanks. Those are easier than the dodgers since they require you to hit them two, three, or four times but in the same direction. (like 3 rights, or 2 lefts and so on).
Fourth comes the mixed ones where they are tanks and dodgers. Those are the ones that have a weird combo to hit them. They require 3 or 4 hits which are like (L-L-R-L, R-R-L-L, R-R-R-L) and so on.
Fifth comes the enemies that have a crown above their heads. These have a so-called brawl attached to them where there is a specific combo that shows on the screen and you must hit the right keys in the right order to get rid of them.
Finally, there are the bosses. Boss fights are cool since a boss changes pattern every time you hit him and has a long life which makes it nice to keep on hitting him right and left.

*Conclusion*
All in all, the game is fun to play and competitive if someone wants to fully complete it. The story isn’t a story, pretty much completing levels to unlock another. Skills are there to upgrade the experience. Weapons are there to spice up the battle and add fun to it. Nobody should ignore this because of its graphic style, because it looks like a web game. Everyone should pretty much play it because it is satisfying and vicious and responsive. For the cool level variety, for the fun and challenge in every level, and just for pure Kung-Fu experience.

Reviewer: Steve UG

Géneros: ['Action', 'Indies', 'Cooperation', 'Multiplayer', 'Platformer', 'Arcade', 'RPG', 'Early Access', 'Linux', 'Action Roguelike', 'Roguelike', 'Twin Stick Shooter', 'Local Co-Op', 'Singleplayer', 'Shooter', '2D', 'Female Protagonist', 'Side Scroller', 'Roguelite', "Shoot 'Em Up", 'Fast-Paced']
Comentario: Rogue Stormers is very cool. Right off the start the intro is very stylish which shows the main groups of enemies. The music and graphics are really good as well as the sound effects. The control is really nice and having a choice of using keyboard or controller is great. If using an Xbox 360 controller the buttons map out automatically , as if you were using a console....awesome! I like the option of being able to play co-op locally (couch) or Online a lot. The game play is very easy to get used to, has fast action and has a very Contra-like feel to it (which I like a lot). There are a lot of upgrades you come across in which most use money you find in game. The world/map changes every time you play which makes the replay factor very high. The action gets pretty intense in which newbies to these types of games will die pretty quick, but if you are like me you'll like the challenge. When you start off you only get to choose one character, but over time you can unlock others. My kids, friends and I are certain to have a lot of fun with Rogue Stormers.

Título: Back to the Future: The Game
Comentario:
A great game based on a movie with the same title. The adventure extends to 5 episodes, with about 3 hours each.
Here we have many characters from the original movie, such as Marty, Doc (Dr Brown), a girlfriend and parents of the main character.
Most of the game's action, as well as episodes happen in a small, well-reproduced from a movie town, though.
We have a linear plot, as well as sudden twists, puzzles at the end of each episode, and joked texts, gags.
The game is characterized by the level of graphics typical for TellTaleGames games, so it's rather cartoonish than real.
I think that Back to the Future is good game for everyone, there is no violence, no vulgarisms, just the fun.

Géneros: ['Action', 'Adventure', 'FPS', 'Mac', 'Indies', 'Early Access', 'Open World Survival Craft', 'Survival', 'Open World', 'Exploration', 'Underwater', 'Crafting', 'Base Building', 'Singleplayer', 'Horror', 'First-Person', 'Sci-fi', 'Sandbox', 'Aliens', 'Atmospheric', 'Survival Horror']
Comentario:
Introduction
Subnautica is an aquatic-themed survival exploration game. The premise of the game is that your spaceship has crashed on this primarily water-filled planet. You are aware of alien life present on the planet and are armed with just a knife. You must explore and survive, with your end goal being get off the planet by rebuilding your ship. 

Breakdown
Early access done right
I’d like to start off by pointing out that this game started out in early access and has been completed. There aren’t many games that do that these days. A lot of developers just take the cash and announce the full release the game without fulfilling their promises, or don’t even release it at all!. Early access survival games are mostly seen as a cash grab rather than an opportunity to make a good game. If anyone is interested in seeing how to go about making an early access game, then Subnautica is the perfect example. The devs deserve kudos for their work and integrity.

Mediocre story, No combat
You read that right. The gameplay is ok, and combat is pretty much non-existent in this game. Your only lethal weapon is a knife in a huge ocean, the primary biome, filled with creatures that want to kill you. The beauty of this game lies in its emphasis on exploration without any combat. You are aware of the alien presence near your crash site from the beginning. You explore to discover hidden caves and bases which give you new technology that helps you fix your ship. The game might not have any combat, but it shows that not every survival game needs to be about killing everything in your way. 

Beautiful World
The game is gorgeous. When you are underwater, the god rays moving make it look lifelike. It gives the water this turquoise tint that makes everything underneath, from plants, to animals, and even the terrain, pop and give it a little more edge. This ties in well with the biggest plus point to this game: the exploration. While exploring in other games may be tedious, and even feel like a chore, in this one, it fits right in with the outstanding visuals present. 

What about replayability?
Sadly, this is one thing the game lacks. There isn’t really any incentive to play the game again after finishing it as the story is mediocre, and once you’ve explored everything, you pretty much know everything about the game. Although, there is a creative mode which eliminates what threats there are and lets you build amazing bases you can call home. Thankfully, the crafting and base building systems are fully fleshed out and this game mode is a fun experience.

A simple yet wonderful game
As you may be able to tell by now, this game is very simple, yet a fun experience. It doesn’t try to do much and what it does, it delivers phenomenally well. If you are looking for a casual game that you can kick back and enjoy, then this is it. Whether it is after a rough day’s work, or through the Sunday afternoon, this game will relax you and keep you hooked at the same time. I haven’t even mentioned that it is just the type of game that showcases the beauty of VR and should be a plus point for VR gamers. Subnautica offers about 20 hours of content, and would make a fine addition to the steam library of anyone who likes relaxing games with an emphasis on exploration. Definitely recommended!

Reviewer: Kevin UG
